boardgame.name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Tile Set
boardgame.description:
The Tile Set is a Kickstarter Exclusive pack for Marvel Zombies that brings a full extra set of all the game tiles included in the core boxes and all expansions. This hefty set of 32 double-sided tiles allows players to create epic custom maps and missions, without being restricted to only using one side of each tile. You can take the elevator between all 3 levels of the X-Mansion in the same game or have all floors of the Baxter Building accessible at the same time! Double the size of Central Park or incorporate it together with the Subway into your New York map. Likewise, you can create a sprawling Hydra Base or take the action directly from it into the S.H.I.E.L.D. Helicarrier. The possibilities are endless!

Please note that the tiles themselves are not exclusive, being the same ones contained in the core boxes and expansions. However, this Tile Set collection will not be going to retail.

–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Clash of the Sinister Six
Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Fantastic Four: Under Siege
Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Hydra Resurrection

boardgame.name: Lords of Lore and Loot
boardgame.description:
Lords of Lore and Loot is a turn based game that allows each player to build their kingdom from within, explore their surroundings, and defeat the other players. Each round consists of accounting for income, building improvements in their kingdom, training combat units, and exploring the countryside with the player's heroes. The heroes can amass an army of various combat units available to each player in their kingdom according to their faction. They can explore the areas surrounding their kingdom, defeat rogue warbands guarding resources, buildings, mines, and artifacts. Experience is gained from defeating rogue warbands and another player's armies. Those guarded treasures can be used to grow the player's kingdom and armies.

The game takes place over a series of Weeks (turns) and Months (4 consecutive turns). Each week players collect gold for from their kingdom. Each month players collect resources from their mines and controlled buildings. Each player's turn consists of actions they can perform. Collect gold. Move their hero up to their movement speed. Engage with any space along their moved path. Spend gold on an improvement in their kingdom. Spend experience to level their hero up. Learn spells and abilities to aid their fighting armies. Fight rogue warbands or other players to take control of valuable spaces. Dice, from the d4 up to the d20, will be used to fight and perform abilities. Each player controls a faction with a set list of units with various combat characteristics and prompts for which dice to use.

The player that conquers all other players or the objectives set out in the chosen scenario wins the game. Conquering a player happens when a player no longer has a kingdom or a hero. They are then removed from the game. Specific scenarios will outline additional game mechanics and win conditions. There is no set number of turns or time limit for the game.

boardgame.name: Judgment Day: JumpStart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you are reading this, then you have already been admitted into the ranks of the Inquisition. Whether you take up the reins as an inquisitor or act as a member of your inquisitor’s retinue, your life has now permanently changed. What I’m about to share with you may never leave the confines of your mind; if it does, you will be branded a rogue and hunted down.

History is a lie. What you learn has been censored by those who would keep you ignorant, but ignorance brings safety. A fragile mind will crack beneath the pressures of the truth and carrying the burden of knowledge can break even the strongest souls. But you are different; you are prepared to be enlightened.

Welcome to the 3rd Edition of Judgment Day, redesigned from the ground-up for the SWADE version of Savage Worlds. What you are reading now is the JumpStart, a minimized version of the much larger Judgment Day core setting guide to get you started in the setting, fighting the supernatural horrors of the late 19th century with tools provided by your employers - the Inquisition.

Judgment Day: JumpStart includes:

Just enough mechanics to understand the game and use the pre-generated characters.
Just enough source material to understand the setting.
An introductory adventure.
Six pre-generated characters to get you into the action.

boardgame.name: Spirit Island: Deluxe Invader Board
boardgame.description:
Finally: a home for the decks in your games of Spirit Island!

The spirits each have their own boards that provide growth options, presence and energy tracks, innate abilities, and more. The game board is the island itself, with lands full of invaders, Dahan, spirit presence, and other inhabitants and snares.

Now, with the Deluxe Invader Board, there is a place for all the rest of the important game elements!

listing.notes:
Brand new copy, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 15 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.
Title: Spirit Island: Deluxe Invader Board Publisher: Greater Than Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Overdue At Tarryton U
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take your adventures to the prestigious Magic College of Tarryton University where a simple errand turns into a moment of magical chaos and harrowing battles in an attempt to save the Grand Library from a collection of magic items gone awry!

The Tarryton University of the Arcane Arts and Mysteries is the foremost authority in magical studies and scholarly pursuits, housing hundreds of students who seek to learn the arcane arts and unlock their magical potential. On top of being the center of magical tutelage, the school’s faculty also regularly perform their research and seek to develop new spells and magical concoctions. Naturally, when the University needs an errant artifact found or an old shrine cleared out, what better way to do so than hire some adventurers?

This Fifth Edition adventure, designed for four characters at 3rd level, will take approximately 3-4 hours and is perfect as either a one-shot or to drop in as an introductory session to your favorite Magical College setting!

boardgame.name: Yuletide Tricks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The sleepy village of Windpoint has been accosted by a trio of tricksy Deep Gnomes for weeks - snatching up food and snatching up candles at every chance they get. When the town finally catches the Lads in the act and arrests them, however, their mother is far from happy. Can your adventurers stop Mother Gryla and her Yule Cat from exacting their revenge on the town before it's too late?

This Fifth Edition adventure, designed for four characters at 9th level, will take approximately 3-4 hours and is perfect as either a one-shot or to drop in to any adventure that takes place in a winter setting or winter season.

boardgame.name: Collapse at the Crystal Caverns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trapped underground after a cave-in thanks to a violent earthquake, the adventurers must make their way through the mysterious crystal caverns to see daylight again! With the ground shaking and strange crystalline creatures around every corner, can they survive?

Collapse at the Crystal Caverns is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 7. This adventure is setting agnostic and can easily be inserted into any setting or campaign of your choice, or it can be run independently of a campaign!

boardgame.name: In the Dead of Winter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Suffering through the brutal winters of the far north for many years, the modest village of Astrakhan has had its fair share of heartache, but none quite as severe as this. Each night, the townsfolk's homes are assailed by vicious creatures in shape of their lost loved ones as they fare through the worst storms they have seen in decades. Some say the village has angered the Old Gods and the only thing to do is repent. Can you help Astrakhan before the cold overtakes the village for good?

In the Dead of Winter is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 10th to 13th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 12.

boardgame.name: The Halls of the Frost Queen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Face off against the formidable Frost Queen and her brothers - or find an alternate path to survival - in this winter adventure set in the blistering cold of the Wailing Forests!

The Wailing Forests have always been a dangerous place, but when a Frost Giant takes over the abandoned fort in the deep North intent on rising to power, any who stand in her path shall suffer. Can your party end her reign before it begins?

The Halls of the Frost Queen is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 12. This adventure is setting agnostic and can easily be inserted into any setting or campaign of your choice, or it can be run independently of a campaign.

boardgame.name: The Tempest Trials
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The underwater village of Amphimara is in grave danger. Every 27 years, the champion of Amphimara performs a sacred set of trials to appease the Tempest gods, but this year, the champion never returned. Can you make your way to the ocean floor and save the village before it's too late?

The Tempest Trials is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 6th to 9th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 7.

boardgame.name: Trouble at the Troll Bridge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The bridges in the bustling town of Chugwater have been taken over by trolls - intent on charging for crossing with violent enforcement. Can you save this city's bridges? And what will you do when you learn there is more to the trolls and their role with these bridges? Find out now in Trouble at the Troll Bridge!

Trouble at the Troll Bridge is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 3rd to 5th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 5.

boardgame.name: The Takedown
boardgame.description:
The FBI is in pursuit of La Famiglia's leader, Vincent Milano. There's a break in the case when gunfire from a warehouse is reported. Upon arrival, law enforcement find several members of Milano's gang deceased from an intense shootout. The warehouse is filled with confusing evidence, and the FBI reaches out to you to help unravel these mysterious events. Can you take down Milano?

The Takedown contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of clues to crack and riddles to solve. Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun.

The Takedown is the second game of the Famiglia Series, the sequel to La Famiglia.

boardgame.name: Save the Cat
boardgame.description:
A game in which we help the firefighter to put out the fire in order to save the kitten that has been trapped on the roof.

Players take turns to roll a dice and do actions: move the firefighter around the board, put out fires or place fires on the board.
If the firefighter manages to get back to the fire engine with the cat all players win. Otherwise everyone loses and the game is over.

A game that works on learning about numbers and their value, generates debate to reach agreements on the best strategy to follow and helps to manage tension.

boardgame.name: Machi Koro: Bau dir deine Verlagswelt!
boardgame.description:
Machi Koro: Bau dir deine Verlagswelt! features gameplay similar to that of Machi Koro, but instead of developing your own city, you are creating your own publishing factory. Editing, marketing, sales: Where should you start? Which projects are other players pursuing?

Machi Koro: Bau dir deine Verlagswelt! is a special edition of Machi Koro to celebrate the 200th anniversary of German publisher KOSMOS.

boardgame.name: Guess My Dress
boardgame.description:
Dress your character as creatively as you can and hide him behind the wardrobe. Now your opponent, based on deductions, must try to dress his character as you have done. If he guesses correctly, he wins!

Each player receives a game board which they place in front of them with the undressed character.
Each player receives a full set of clothes.
One game has two rounds and each round has three steps:
1: Player 1 dresses their character
2: Player 2 uses their intuition to dress their character then asks player 1 to validate their guess using the validation counters.
3: If player 2 has correctly guessed all three items of clothing win their round. If they have guessed any of the clothes incorrectly, they have to interpret the validation counters to deduce the correct combination. Then, player 2 repeats step 2, modifying their character’s outfit and asking for a new validation.
If player 2 does not guess the winning combination after five attempts, they lose their round.
The number of attempts is marked on the counter panel.

When the first round has finished, the players switch roles and play a second round: player 1 becomes player 2 and vice versa.

If both players have won a round each, the winner is the person who won their round with the least number of guesses.

boardgame.name: Cats in Time
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

Hello explorers!
My name is Professor Tim Edger, and I'm the inventor of the time machine and an avid cat lover! Sadly, I have a problem, and maybe YOU can help me.
You see, my beloved cats are missing. While playing in the lab, they've activated my time machine and ⚡ZAP ⚡, now they are lost in space and time! You have to travel from ancient Egypt, all the way to the streets of late 20. century New York, and even beyond the present - to future Tokyo.
Your goal is to find all the cats! Please be careful; these cats are really good at hiding.

boardgame.name: 1814: The Norwegian War of Independence
boardgame.description:
During the Napoleonic wars, the Kingdoms of Denmark-Norway and Sweden found themselves on opposite sides, and fought several skirmishes in the border areas between the countries. This game deals with the 1814 campaign (a 1808 scenario will be provided later).

The game is a low-complexity wargame, with units representing battalions of infantry (about 350-400 men), batteries of artillery and squadrons of dragoons and cavalry (about 75-100 men). The Swedes have regular cavalry units like hussars, the Norwegians have dragoons and mounted jaegers. The Swedes enjoy better training, better supplies and more fire power, the Norwegians have advantages in mobility and skirmish ability, employing ski troops and light infantry (jaegers/sharpshooters).

The game map uses point-to-point movement and covers the border area between Norway and Sweden from Frederikshald (Halden) to Trondheim. The Swedish objective is to break the Norwegian lines and capture Christiania (Oslo), the border forts, (and perhaps Trondheim if they choose to try. The Norwegian objective is to prevent the Swedes from winning by inflicting enough casualties and delay the Swedes long enough to force negotiations to start.

The game was originally released in 2018 as a zip-lock, hex-based system with a print run of just 100. (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/300929/norwegian-war-ind...).
The game has been completely redesigned and is in reality a completely new game on the same topic, rather than a new version of the old game.

This is the first game in the Scandinavian Wars Trilogy from Pantero Games.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Greyjoy Heroes 2
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Héros Greyjoy I
boardgame.description:
The Kraken’s Many Arms in the Fight

A Kraken’s many tentacles can seemingly act independently from one-another, but always for the greater good of the creature. So, too, do the various individuals within House Greyjoy. Though they sometimes are at odds with one-another, each one feels what they’re doing is best overall for the House.

The Greyjoy Heroes 2 box set for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Greyjoy players lots of new options for their forces. The set contains new unique characters, including both UAs and NCUs, with several new options for army Commanders as well. Each one has their own goals, but all are working for the greater good of House Greyjoy.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Shadow Tower Spearmen
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Lanciers de la Tour Ombreuse
boardgame.description:
The Shadow Tower Spearmen Protect the Wall’s Flanks From Attack

Everyone in Westeros knows of The Wall and the stalwart Night’s Watch that mans it. Slightly less well-known is what are on the flanks of the towering edifice. To the West, there’s the Shadow Tower. There, the brothers in black specialize in wielding spears, making them masters at defending against flanking maneuvers of enemy fast-attack.

The Shadow Tower Spearmen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Night’s Watch players a new melee unit with which to protect their flanks. These troops train ceaselessly with their long spears, making them capable of inflicting severe damage on anyone foolish enough to try and charge them. They also know that their duty is to never break and run, standing unyielding against any enemy.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Mormont Bruisers
Le Trône de Fer: Jeu de Figurines – Cogneurs Mormont
boardgame.description:
House Mormont’s Bruisers Make a Dangerous Foe to Attack

House Mormont’s sigil is a great bear. Strong, tough, and decidedly deadly, the House’s sigil fits well with the troops that they field in war. For example, thought the unit known as the Bruisers are not highly armed or armored, no foe wants to see them on the other side of a battlefield. Their tenacity means that they don’t stop fighting until the very last one of them is cut down.

The House Mormont Bruisers Unit Box for House Stark in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives players a rough and tumble melee unit for their forces. They eschew heavy armor and shields in exchange for raw attacking power, enough that their ferocity even shows through when defending. Their light shields are equipped with a punching spike, letting them be on the offensive even when on the defensive. Enemies must be wary of missed attacks when going after the Bruisers.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark vs Lannister Starter Set

boardgame.name: Tusk!: Surviving the Ice Age
boardgame.description:
It's a race against time as the Ice Age approaches. You will need strength and food to survive and lots of it. The mammoth offers your tribes food beyond your wildest dreams, but they are powerful beasts.

In Tusk!, you and your fellow players will need to team up to hunt successfully — but there can be only one master of the hunt, and to ensure that's you and your tribe, you need to manipulate alliances, horde supplies, and make use of the land's many resources to become the most powerful tribe. The game ends when snow covers the entire playing area, and the tribe with the most food wins!

boardgame.name: Vagrantsong: Bonus Scenario – Fool's Gold
boardgame.description:
You have to fill out a form on the publisher's website to get the promo, it's not included with every copy of the base game. Offered for free as part of a Wyrd Games Promotion in January and February 2022.

The Scenario includes a small Scenario booklet for the Scenario itself, 2 Skill cards, 3 Ritual cards for that Scenario, and a Junk card. It utilizes existing standees from the core game, but gives them a new story.

A Junk card is shuffled into the Junk deck immediately triggers the Scenario when revealed during the Camp Phase.

listing.notes: Brand new from publisher, unopened. Will ship to continental US via USPS in sturdy envelope.

boardgame.name: PARKS Memories: Boxed Set
boardgame.description:
Collection box for:
PARKS Memories: Plains Walker
PARKS Memories: Mountaineer
PARKS Memories: Coast to Coast

PARKS Memories is a strategic matching game for two or more players offering simple and flexible gameplay. Parks are represented in tiles laid out in a grid across the table face down. Gameplay includes four simple steps: reveal two tiles; choose one of the revealed tiles and place it in front of you; add a new tile to the board; lock one of the tiles with the hiker token. Gameplay passes from person to person until one player or team has collected three sets of matching park tiles in front of them.

Memories captures a depth of strategy in player abilities which can be activated by finding matches of PARKS resource icons when you reveal tiles. There are a variety of ways to enjoy the game. Play a head to head game, or on teams. Expand the grid size for a bigger challenge, or simplify the game to a memory game without player abilities for younger gamers.

PARKS Memories: Plains Walkers is one of three editions of PARKS Memories, highlighting the national parks of the plains region of the United States. It features a uniques set of player abilities. Collectively all three editions showcase every US national park.

boardgame.name: Evermore Mansion: The Forbidding Foyer
boardgame.description:
You and your party of property investors are eager to view the illustrious Evermore Mansion that has just gone up for sale, but not everything is as it seems. Strange damages, missing documents, and cryptic notes alert you to something far more sinister inside this home.

Envelescape brings together the immersive nature of pop-up books with the puzzling mysteries of escape rooms. Explore a miniature 3D room by finding clues and solving puzzles. By utilizing intricate pop-up engineering, our rooms and clues fold down to fit into a single envelope.

Each Envelescape game (also known as a Chapter) includes a pop-up room to explore, papercraft and digital clues, and a thrilling mystery to uncover! By solving puzzles in the pop-up room you will unlock clues that will help you progress even further - just like a real escape room!

boardgame.name: Mission Catastrophe: Maximum Danger
boardgame.description: Add more danger and more fun with two additional characters (Leeloo and D4VID), 6 Asimo V robots with docking tray, 12 modules (Shields, , 19 PIP cards, 36 role cards, 16 control discs, 4 shield cubes and the Renegade Robots solo/co-op mode.

boardgame.name: The 40th Birthday Game
boardgame.description:
The 40th Birthday Game is a light-hearted trivia game that adds a healthy dollop of fun to any 40th birthday.

Created solely for this landmark occasion, the special edition game has a traditional question-and-answer format. The professionally written and absorbing questions are designed to intrigue, surprise and amuse. All the questions are on the theme of forty, making it wholly suitable for the big occasion.

Players form two teams which take turns to answer questions.
Correct answers win cards, and the first team to win 7 cards wins.

If a team answers a question correctly, they can choose to "stick" (which ends their turn) or "play on". If they play on and get the next question incorrect, they lose all cards they've won on the current turn (i.e. the penalty for not sticking). Ending your turn with a "stick" means you keep your cards, and will not be able to lose them on a future turn.

boardgame.name: Avichrom
boardgame.description:
Mother Nature has unpacked her complete colour palette in the world of birds, so that a native bird species can be found for eleven colours by name. In Avichrom, you cleverly play colourful feather cards to attract the magnificent birds.

A player may play one to two feather cards per turn. Matching feather colours are placed under each other to form rows. As an alternative to playing cards, a player may also attract birds. A bird flies into the row with the most feathers of its colour. Some of the birds have effects that can be used immediately.

When the "End of the Day" card is turned over, each player has one more turn with two actions. After that, the scoring will take place. Points are awarded for the number of feathers of the same colour in each row and for the birds attracted. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Legacy's Allure: Season 1
boardgame.description:
Legacy's Allure is a customizable, card-based wargame with no randomness. Imagine chess but with customization, deeper mechanics, and a high-fantasy theme. Legacy's Allure has been called a "streamlined wargame" due to its elegance and accessibility.

Each player begins the game by drafting an army of an agreed upon size from their deck, also known as a "kingdom". Then players alternate taking turns in which they may perform a single action with one of their units: moving, attacking, or using an ability. After a unit acts, it is exhausted until the end of the round and cannot act again. Once all units on the board are exhausted, they are refreshed and a new round begins. The game ends at the end of the seventh round. At that time, the attacking player wins if they occupy the central hex with one of their units. Otherwise, the defending player wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Adventure Land
boardgame.description:
Lights, Cameras, Action! 2-5 adventurous tycoons compete to build the most attractive movie park. With a jump start, you take control of a small park. Bid & choose from various attractions in different themes, employ your favourite staff members, and execute special actions to increase your control. Secret assignments contribute to the high tension in the game. When your park becomes prosperous, it attracts celebrities, which are valuable influencers to promote your park further and increase your income. But beware, other tycoons are anxiously looking at your progress and want to sabotage your plans… literally. This exciting game is one big adventure! Buckle up and go for it!!

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Dungeonbowl
boardgame.description:
When Blood Bowl 3rd edition was released in 1994 Games workshop soon also made an article with new rules for Dungeonbowl. The rules was published in White Dwarf 225, September 1998. Now it was much more narrow corridors and not so much space to move around. The new rules gave a more claustrophobic feeling to the game. Dungeonbowl changed a lot with these new things.

Dungeonbowl are two fantasy football teams playing a game in a dungeon. First they have to find the ball in one of the chests. Then they have to score a touchdown in the opponents endzone to win the game.

The original game was Elves, Dwarfs & Dungeonbowl from 1989. In December 2021 there was a third version of the game in Dungeon Bowl.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Oganika: KIDS
boardgame.description:
A 36 card pack with a themed developmental thread to lead the puzzler through a variety of puzzles revealing principles and developing understanding of the Oganika tile set.

It challenges children to create animals and funny faces.

boardgame.name: Oganika: Geometria
boardgame.description: An extension pack of 36 stand alone designs which compliment the initial set of Oganika puzzles contained within the main Oganika box. Each geometric design consists of 36 tiles meaning that puzzlers must implement the whole tile set in order to solve.

boardgame.name: Oganika: Diamonds
boardgame.description: An intense and challenging puzzling experience for use with the Oganika tile set. 36 linked cards slowly develop a deep understanding into the potential underlying geometry of a diamond shaped module. The puzzles become more and more difficult and complex, leading the puzzler slowly to towards a concluding 3D net which may or may not be possible

boardgame.name: Libellus Lunae
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A Small Book of the Moon

- A tiny spell book to physically hand your players at the table.
- Contains five moon rituals
- Each ritual is diegetically balanced so that there is no need for a "magic system"
- Rituals are time specific in order to make strict time records meaningful
- System neutral and complainant with Mosaic Strict but with OSR and NSR games in mind

boardgame.name: Play Nine: Golf Card Game
boardgame.description: App version of the card game Play Nine.

boardgame.name: Winterhaven Woods: Winterhaven Wonders
boardgame.description:
Winterhaven Wonders is an expansion to Winterhaven Woods. It introduces 3 new card types:

WINTERHAVEN LEGENDS - These cards change up how each species works during the game. They add a level of variability to each game, and give you a new strategies to focus on. They are shuffled into the Woods deck and when they come up in your hand they are placed in the center of the table. You draw a card to replace it in your hand, just like wolves in 2P. They then affect all players for the rest of the game because no one player can own a Legend.

MOTHER NATURE CARDS - These cards are drafted and played into a players meadow during the plant and populate phase. They may then be used on a future round to alter play.

VARIABLE BONUSES - These bonuses randomize the end game scoring bonuses from game to game.

boardgame.name: Spire's End: Rat King Card
boardgame.description:
This is a small, non-essential way to add a touch of diversity to the deck! If you would like to change things up, swap out card 15 with the Rat King! It's a more challenging alternative of the Under-Rat.

Replaces the Under-Rat card as an enemy:
The Rat King does not use Action Cards. The Rat King's turn consist of one Action: Nip, Nibble, Chomp or Gnaw. The Rat King has no Recoup. If you defeat the Rat King. Reveal Card 16.

boardgame.name: The Lair of the Shaggy Beast
boardgame.description: A new one page dungeon from Nobboc.

boardgame.name: Succulent: TidyGamer Insert
boardgame.description:
Use this colorful 3D-printed insert to organize your Succulent board game. These trays are designed to fit within the existing insert. (So you can keep the art!) The trays feature curved surfaces and cutouts to make it easier to get the pieces out. There is individual storage for each color of player tokens. It includes one large tray to organize the different colored cuttings pieces. There's a 3D fountain to hold the water droplets. Flower bed tiles fit perfectly in the divided green tray. This insert will keep your game pieces organized without having to fiddle with plastic baggies. You can simply set the trays on the table and you are ready to play!

What's included:

1x Cuttings Tray (beige/tan) to store the 5 colors of cuttings pieces.
1x Flower Bed Tray (green) to store the 3 sizes of flower bed tiles.
4x Player piece Trays (blue, yellow, pink, and white) to store the flowers and player marker for each player's color.
1x Deck Box to store the cards.
1x 3D fountain (grey) to hold the water droplets. Large droplets fit in the top tier of the fountain and the smaller ones fit in the lower tier. Fountain has a lid to keep droplets from spilling when the game is moved or stored on its side.
1x Spacer (black) to keep things from moving around too much/minimize spilling when the game is moved or stored on its side.

-- from Publisher

boardgame.name: The Cursed Scroll: DIABLERIE
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Cursed knights channeling demonic power, mist-addled forests where witches and warlocks stalk the trees, and crumbling castles housing ancient, eldritch creatures!

boardgame.name: Arlukkachase: Card Game
boardgame.description:
Get the key, win the game.

But wait! One plays as the dark power infecting players on the way. Get infected & you join the dark side. If everyone is infected, the dark team wins. This isn't squid game but it is a race to the key.

In this card game, players take turns drawing or putting a card into the deck until someone wins (find the key card).

Can you get the key before they get you!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Professor Gilroy's Guide to Fey
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"My name is Professor Gilligan G. Gilroy and I have dedicated my life to the study of the fey folk that share our world. I have traveled to the rocky coasts where Selkies sing and the damp moors where Grindylow dwell. I have sat with the Wandering Man and danced with Veela. And I must tell you, dear reader, that despite your grandmother’s warnings, these creatures are more than just monsters."

Professor Gilroy’s Guide to Fey brings you creatures that are more than just piles of hit points to be slaughtered by your players. Many of the creatures in the Guide can be used as quest givers, beloved NPCs, or present challenges that cannot be solved through traditional means. Professor Gilroy’s Guide will give you the tools to create dynamic, memorable encounters both inside AND outside of combat.
But going beyond the creature design, each entry includes detailed lore, favored tactics, and encounter hooks to spark your imagination. Many of the entries include magical items and mystical boons as loot or rewards for your players. This potent combination lets you spend more time playing and less time prepping.

All together you will recieve:

4 new ancestries
5 beautiful feywild maps from ChristianZeuch
54 new, beautifully illustrated creatures with detailed lore and monster tactics
200+ Encounter hooks to spark your imagination

boardgame.name: Valavendur
boardgame.description:
In Valavendur you fight as a sorcerer for the rule over the magic land Valavendur.

Players play hidden karma and attack cards against each other and bet the game currency Vita to attack their opponents. Using Vita allows players to build towers in the kindgoms of Valavendur.

You need to be able to read and bluff your opponents and build your towers in a strategic way to get the most points in the end to win this game. Each round a player plays one karma or attack card and the game ends when all karma and attack cards have been played or when a single player has built 50 towers on the board.

boardgame.name: Inn-Fighting: Drunken Caravan Guard mini promo
boardgame.description:
This is a promotional mini that was given out in random booster sets of D&D War of the Dragon Queen as well as conventions in 2007

Drunken Caravan Guard HP:2 +1 damage with Chair attacks
Aberrant Lurch: (Attack misses, but Drunken Caravan Guard hits his head and forgets who his allies were. Every player rolls a d20, the highest roller gains control of Drunken Caravan Guard.

The mini is just a bonus.

boardgame.name: Shrine of Oldoric the Cruel
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Deep in the jungle a lost shrine to a forgotten goddess bodes ill will. A bookmark adventure for 2-5 players of 4th-6th level.

boardgame.name: Baneful Cavern of Landina of the Berserk Skull
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Deep in the raven black woods where the foothills meet the great mountains is rumored to be a small cavern that is home to werewolves.

A bookmark adventure for 2-5 players of 3rd-5th level.

boardgame.name: Obscene Pits of Ekis the Dark
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Ekis the cleric of light was tricked by a devil to open pits to the infernal realms. He is now enslaved by the dark powers until the pits can be closed.

A bookmark adventure for 2-5 players of 5th-7th level.

boardgame.name: Putrid Citadel of Ebregisel the Spider Soul Eater
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

On the edge of civilization stands a ruined citadel that is now home to rapacious arachnids.

A bookmark adventure for 2-5 players of 4th-6th level.

boardgame.name: Shady Bastion of Teutbert the Deadly
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Once the king's most trusted soldier, Teutbert has turned against the order of holy paladins he once belonged to. Now he rules an armed rebellion from a fortified bastion on the edge of the kingdom.

A bookmark adventure for 2-5 players of 3rd-5th level.

boardgame.name: Shiryū de la Balance promo card
boardgame.description:
A card to add to Saint-Seiya The Deckbuilding Game.

Détruire : Un Héros en jeu gagne +1 Force et +1 Cosmos
Destroy: A Hero in play gains +1 Strength and +1 Cosmos

Vaincu : Blesser tous les Personnages utilisés pour le vaincre, puis piocher autant de cartes que de Personnages ainsi blessés

Defeated: Injure all the Characters used to defeat him, then draw as many cards as Characters thus injured

boardgame.name: Hyōga du Verseau promo card
boardgame.description:
A card to add to Saint-Seiya The Deckbuilding Game.

Détruire : Tous les Personnages gelés sont détruits.

Destroy: All frozen Characters are destroyed.

Vaincu : En commençant par le joueur actif et jusqu'à ce que le terrain soit vidé, chaque joueur acquiert une carte du terrain qu'il gèle.

Defeated: Starting with the active player and until the field is emptied, each player acquires a card from the field they freeze.

boardgame.name: Heartfire Lost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the undersea domain of Thalassia, your heart lights your way. Everyone has a flame, called heartfire, which represents their greatest desire literally burning in their chest. Now the archfey has lost her heartfire, and the domain lies in darkness.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Everything's Fine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the Domains of Delight is a seaside domain called Shoreline.

Monsters are being sent into the mountains along the northern border of Shoreline to displace inhabitants and claim the mountains as territory for a rival domain. Inconveniently for Shoreline’s Archfey, this coincides with a visit from a powerful Efreet who pays well to stay in a quiet mountain retreat. Can a party of adventurers control the monsters to keep Shoreline from being held responsible by an offended Efreet?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

The party is on the clock to root out any monsters that might pose an annoyance to Shoreline's visitor.

Content Awareness: Hunting/Hunted, Surprise Attack, Brutalized Corpses
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: The Hat That Spat Rats
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An elven woman, desperate for the return of her kidnapped daughter, coerces unsuspecting adventurers into a deceptive corner of the Feywild known as The Land of Sweet Nothings. In this, the first of the Sweet Nothings series, characters acclimate to their new surroundings and make a deal to help a pixie find a hat.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

WBW-DC-LSN-01: The Hat That Spat Rats

Maps and additional art included. This product also includes a printer-friendly version of the adventure.

This adventure is part 1 of a 4-part series taking characters from level 1 to level 5.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Uprising
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Thayans are fortifying buildings in the center of Xorvintroth. It’s time to figure out why they’re here.

Part Three of the The Cold Dark series of adventures.

A four hour adventure for 11th through 16th level characters.

Optimized for: APL 13

Content Warnings: oppression (slavery, child slavery, racism, tyranny), mental health (Far Realm effects, anxiety, delusions, hallucinations), nonconsensual reanimation of the dead, explosives, abuse (psychological torture, starvation).
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: Klątwa Świetlistej Ścieżki
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Klątwa Świetlistej Ścieżki to zwariowana przygoda w pełnym cudów i niebezpieczeństw świecie fantasy. Znajdziecie tu potężną magię, niezwykłe bestie, mroczne sekrety i diabolicznych złoczyńców. Nie mówiąc nawet o pradawnych artefaktach, ryzykownych wyzwaniach i drużynie gotowych do akcji postaci. Czy odważycie się wyruszyć na Świetlistą Ścieżkę? Przygoda wzywa!

boardgame.name: Generator Goblinów, Bandytów I Szkieletów
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zestaw trzech generatorów, pozwalających na szybkie, proste tworzenie unikalnych szkieletów, goblinów i bandytów, możliwych do wykorzystania w czasie sesji Fajerbola i pokrewnych gier. Każdy generator pozwala określić atrybuty, talenty i przedmioty tworzonego potwora oraz zapewnia mu trzy cechy nadające dodatkowego kolorytu.

Każdy z generatorów mieści się na jednej stronie, więc może być wygodnie drukowany oraz powielany.

boardgame.name: Widzowie
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dodatek kompatybilny z grą Fajerbol i pokrewnymi tytułami. Pozwala na aktywizowanie osób, które z różnych powodów nie chcą w niej uczestniczyć jako gracze. Zapewnia widzom niewielki, ale satysfakcjonujący wkład w przebieg rozgrywki, bez potrzeby zagłębiania się w zasady gry, czy odgrywania postaci.

boardgame.name: Najmniejsza Twierdza Świata: Szmery Bajery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Szmery Bajery to dodatek zawierający materiały do przygody Najmniejsza Twierdza Świata. Pozwala on na wprowadzenie do gry nowych rodzajów goblinów, zatrudnienie najemników i zdecydowanie, że oblężona sławojka to w rzeczywistości śpiący smacznie mimik!

boardgame.name: Najmniejsza Twierdza Świata
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sam środek śnieżnej i mroźnej zimy w Górach Sinych. Zimna, gwieździsta noc. Bohater nocuje w zajeździe Górska Kolebka przy trakcie znikającym w głębi świerkowego lasu. Wiedziony pilną potrzebą, nasz bohater udaje się do latryny kilkanaście kroków od Zajazdu i wtedy właśnie rozpoczyna się najazd goblinów! Dziesiątki zielonoskórych potworków roją się dookoła, wrzeszcząc i przeklinając. Strzecha zajazdu w mgnieniu oka staje w płomieniach, wyrwani ze snu goście umierają w ogniu albo giną na śniegu, naszpikowani goblińskimi strzałami podczas prób wydostania się z płonącej pułapki. Garstka zielonych pokurczów zauważa, że ktoś jest w wygódce i rusza do ataku! Wyjście na zewnątrz oznacza niechybną śmierć od strzał przeważających sił wroga, więc pozostaje desperacka obrona najmniejszej twierdzy świata.

Najmniejsza Twierdza Świata to krótka, humorystyczna przygoda wykorzystująca zasady gry fabularnej Fajerbol. Do jej rozegrania potrzebny jest podręcznik podstawowy do Fajerbola, papier, ołówki, kości sześcienne i około godziny wolnego czasu. Scenariusz opowiada o jednej postaci, więc można rozegrać go w dwie osoby (jedna będzie narratorem, a druga graczem), ale też nic nie stoi na przeszkodzie, żeby kilkoro graczy wspólnie decydowało o kolejnych posunięciach śmiałka.

boardgame.name: Tohuwabohu - Legenda Miętkiej Nindży
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sam środek śnieżnej i mroźnej zimy w Górach Sinych. Zimna, gwieździsta noc. Bohater nocuje w zajeździe Górska Kolebka przy trakcie znikającym w głębi świerkowego lasu. Wiedziony pilną potrzebą, nasz bohater udaje się do latryny kilkanaście kroków od Zajazdu i wtedy właśnie rozpoczyna się najazd goblinów! Dziesiątki zielonoskórych potworków roją się dookoła, wrzeszcząc i przeklinając. Strzecha zajazdu w mgnieniu oka staje w płomieniach, wyrwani ze snu goście umierają w ogniu albo giną na śniegu, naszpikowani goblińskimi strzałami podczas prób wydostania się z płonącej pułapki. Garstka zielonych pokurczów zauważa, że ktoś jest w wygódce i rusza do ataku! Wyjście na zewnątrz oznacza niechybną śmierć od strzał przeważających sił wroga, więc pozostaje desperacka obrona najmniejszej twierdzy świata.

Najmniejsza Twierdza Świata to krótka, humorystyczna przygoda wykorzystująca zasady gry fabularnej Fajerbol. Do jej rozegrania potrzebny jest podręcznik podstawowy do Fajerbola, papier, ołówki, kości sześcienne i około godziny wolnego czasu. Scenariusz opowiada o jednej postaci, więc można rozegrać go w dwie osoby (jedna będzie narratorem, a druga graczem), ale też nic nie stoi na przeszkodzie, żeby kilkoro graczy wspólnie decydowało o kolejnych posunięciach śmiałka.

boardgame.name: Coin Set
boardgame.description:
Coin Set is a game in which you and a group of friends compete to find patterns and sets in a selection of coins, plucked at random from a bag. Each coin has a number of different characteristics. Your task is to locate sets of three coins where each of these characteristics is either all different, or all the same. And you have to do it quickly – because everyone’s competing at the same time and waiting for the opportunity to spot patterns, shout “Set!” and claim the coins for themselves.

The game is played exactly like Set, but the rules simply state the winner is the person who manages to find the most sets during the course of the game. The game ends when the bag is empty and no more sets can be found.".

It’s trickier than it might seem, because every one of every coin’s four defining characteristics needs to be considered. As a result, Coin Set is a test of your observation and thoroughness as well as how quick-witted you are. If you think you’ve found a set, but have failed to consider one of the characteristics, you’ll lose three of the coins you’ve collected so far. So you need to pay real attention to detail, thinking fast but not being too hasty. One thing is for sure: keeping a cool head will help you find order in the chaos.

Legend has it that these coins were found at the bottom of the Med by none other than Jacques Cousteau. But whatever the backstory, Coin Set is a quick and quirky brain-teaser, a fast-paced and intermittently frenetic way to test your attention to detail and your ability to see a slightly bigger, more complex picture than one coin alone can show you. Plus: it’s small enough to fit in your pocket, and encased in a robust little tin that’ll keep it safe wherever you might take it.

boardgame.name: Zombiaki w Centrum Handlowym!
boardgame.description:
Zombie-Dwupak!

Zombiaki w Centrum Handlowym! to prosta gra fabularna o ludziach, których apokalipsa zombie zastała w Centrum Handlowym. Przed głównym wejściem czeka wojsko, nadzieja ocalałych, ale najpierw trzeba się tam dostać!
...
Pojedyncza sesja w każdą z gier powinna opowiadać historię jednej ucieczki i trwać około godziny, więc świetnie nada się na imprezy, wyjazdy, konwenty, oraz inne niezobowiązujące spotkania ze znajomymi.

boardgame.name: Waleczne Wiewióry
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Waleczne Wiewióry to prosta gra fabularna, w której gracze wcielają się w wiewiórczych superbohaterów broniących Lasu przed zakusami różnego rodzaju superzłoczyńców przy użyciu swoich niesamowitych mocy.
...
Pojedyncza sesja gry powinna opowiadać historię jednej misji i trwać około godziny, więc świetnie nada się na imprezy, wyjazdy, konwenty, oraz inne niezobowiązujące spotkania ze znajomymi.

boardgame.name: Ferajna Pazurów
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ferajna Pazurów to gra fabularna opowiadająca o załodze kocich piratów, która zawsze wpakuje się w jakąś niebezpieczną kabałę i zawsze znajdzie okazję, żeby na tym zarobić.
...
Pojedyncza sesja gry powinna opowiadać historię jednej awantury i trwać około godziny, więc świetnie nada się na imprezy, wyjazdy, konwenty, oraz inne niezobowiązujące spotkania ze znajomymi.

boardgame.name: Te Inne Zombiaki w Centrum Handlowym!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Te Inne Zombiaki w Centrum Handlowym! to trochę inna gra o innych ludziach, których apokalipsa zombie zastała w innym Centrum Handlowym, ale też chcą uciec!
...
Pojedyncza sesja w każdą z gier powinna opowiadać historię jednej ucieczki i trwać około godziny, więc świetnie nada się na imprezy, wyjazdy, konwenty, oraz inne niezobowiązujące spotkania ze znajomymi.

boardgame.name: Szlamy&Szkielety
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Przygoda wzywa! Wspólnie z przyjaciółmi poznaj królestwo Öphagii, gdzie nic nie jest takie, jakie się wydaje. Staw czoła jego horrorom, odkryj jego sekrety i sięgnij po jego skarby.

Szlamy&Szkielety to opis fantastycznego świata inspirowanego wczesnymi grami fabularnymi i opowieściami niesamowitymi, kompatybilny z zasadami gry Freeform Universal. Znajdziesz w nim najważniejsze informacje o królestwie Öphagii oraz całe mnóstwo pomysłów na postacie, deskryptorów, miejsc, rekwizytów i stworzeń pomocnych przy tworzeniu własnych fantastycznych historii.

User summary:

Requires the occasional use of FU: the Free, Universal RPG.

boardgame.name: Öphagian Exile
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Curiosity is the first step to hell, but for some reason it didn’t kill this cat yet. You’ve looked too closely at the dark corners of your home kingdom of Öphagia. The rumors are contradictory: some say you gone completely mad and ran off one day, others that you’ve dug too deep and were exiled by the rich and the mighty. To be honest, you yourself are not certain what to believe at times, as reality flickers and twists around you.

This class is a crossover between the horrors of Mörk Borg and the weirdness of Slimes&Skeletons. Try it for yourself!

boardgame.name: Bluźnierczy Bełkot
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bluźnierczy Bełkot to zbiór materiałów do gry Szlamy&Szkielety na silniku Freeform Universal i żeby w pełni go zrozumieć oraz wykorzystać niezbędna jest znajomość podręczników podstawowych do FU oraz Sz&Sz. Nie zawadzi też znajomość innych suplementów do Szlamów&Szkieletów oraz rozegranie kilku sesji według podstawowych zasad Freeform Universal. Całość została przygotowana z myślą o osobach, które lubią eksperymentować i rozwijać gry na własną rękę. Nie ma tu stuprocentowo pewnych, niepodważalnych zasad, które na pewno będą działać. Jest za to całe mnóstwo wskazówek i pomysłów, jak tworzyć własne materiały do Sz&Sz, dostosowywać świat i uniwersum do swoich potrzeb oraz jak prowadzić, żeby zaskakiwać i bawić pozostałych uczestników gry.

boardgame.name: Czarna Xięga Nieszczęść
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Czarna Xięga Nieszczęść zawiera osiem krótkich, niebezpiecznych spotkań z uniwersum Szlamów&Szkieletów. Każde z nich może posłużyć jako pojedyncza scena w czasie gry, zaczątek nowego wątku albo inspiracja do stworzenia dłuższej przygody. Poszczególne opowieści nie są ze sobą w żaden sposób powiązane, ale ci sami bohaterowie mogą zmierzyć się ze wszystkimi w dowolnej kolejności. Każda historia rozpoczyna się od luźno powiązanej z nią ilustracji i zawiera wszystkie najpotrzebniejsze informacje, żeby wprowadzić ją do gry, ale jednocześnie każda może wymagać rozmaitych uzupełnień i modyfikacji, żeby wpasować się w oczekiwania uczestników gry i rozgrywaną aktualnie przygodę.

Przeczytaj, zainspiruj się, poprowadź.

Przygoda wzywa!

boardgame.name: Czupakabra vs Gigantakonda
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Czupakabra vs Gigantakonda to rozszerzenie modułu Ekstaza Błogosławionej Siostry Czupakabry z Laufreich do gry Szlamy&Szkielety na silniku Freeform Universal. Pozwala na wprowadzenie do gry dwóch nowych, powiązanych ze sobą lokacji: kryjówki zbójców w Laufreich i leża Gigantakondy w Velacez oraz powiązanych z nimi postaci, przedmiotów i wyzwań. Przekonaj się, co skrywają -przygoda wzywa!

boardgame.name: Home Sweet Home
boardgame.description:
Win the maximum number of points by counting how many windows there are in each façade and placing the corresponding roof card on the top.

Each player starts with 6 card on hand and takes turns to play.

Players can do either of these two actions:
A: Place cards on the table
In each turn, players can place one façade card on the table:
- a door card: to start constructing a new building next to the existing ones
- a storey card: placed on top of a building already in construction
In addition to playing your façade cards, you can, at any time during your turn, place one or more roof cards on top of the buildings. To do so, the value on your roof card must equal the total number of windows on the building’s façade.

B: Swap cards with other players
player can force an exchange with another player if they have 3 grey façade cards

When there are no more cards left in the pile and no more moves possible, the game is over. Add up the values of all the roof cards that each player has placed on their buildings. The player with the most points is the winner.

boardgame.name: À la Cuisine
boardgame.description:
Make the recipes to win the maximum number of points. To make a recipe, you must have a recipe card and all the ingredient cards necessary to prepare the dish.

Each player receives 7 cards, dealt face down showing the "Kitchen Closed" side. Next, 9 cards are placed face up in the middle of the table, laid out in a square. The remaining cards are put face down in a pile.

When game starts players can swap the cards in their hand for cards that are in the middle of the table. They can do this as many times as they like, but always one by one.

When a player has a recipe card and all the necessary ingredients to make it, they shout: ‘A la cuisine!’.

When there are no more cards left in the pile the game is over. Then, the players add up the values of all the recipe cards they have completed. The player who gets the highest score wins the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Free Man
boardgame.description:
Free Man is a 78-card tabletop game for 2 to 4 players. It is based on the 1967 television series "The Prisoner". The objective of the game is to escape from The Village and become a "Free Man".

This entails following the route detailed on one of ten "Route Cards", collecting cards along the way, placing some face up in a "Declaration Pile" (to satisfy different route requirements) while keeping others hidden and using them to gain abilities and/or thwart other players. Winning requires a combination of skill, luck, and cunning.

The game is won when the final card required for a player's route (a special card called a "Victory Card") is placed in that player's Declaration Pile.

boardgame.name: Random Tables: Cities and Towns
boardgame.description:
(Back of Book)

Take your fantasy world to the next level!

Adventurers love to ask tough questions - questions that can sometimes put Game Masters on the spot and put their Game Masters on the spot and put their creative skills to the test. Never fear! Random Tables: Cities and Towns is your new indispensable sidekick for creating unexpected treasures, plotting villainous townsfolk, and inspiring thrilling adventurers.

Designed for fans of tabletop role-playing games like Dungeons & Dragons, this reference book of randomized tables allows Game Masters to generate on-the-fly content for adventures traveling, shopping, or simply passing through towns and cities. Never be stumped again when asked:

What building is across the street from the thieves’ guild headquarters?

Who runs the local potion shop.

What’s in the pocket of a random townsperson?

Whose grave are we robbing?

What’s on the menu at the inn?

Generate all of these answers and more by rolling on the dozens of randomized tables provided within these pages. Use them to guide your adventure or just to kick-start your own imaginative juices. Keep your players guessing, your story fresh, and your setting vivid and alive with new, random non-player characters and locations every session!

boardgame.name: Solomon Kane: FAQ & Errata Pack
boardgame.description:
The FAQ & Errata pack consists of a 12-page booklet, 48 Discovery Cards, and a 5th Player Aid.

Please note that the 5th Player Aid was not missing from the core game, as the normal amount was 4. It is provided in this pack because many players have been asking for it.

This pack was available for free to backers of the Soloman Kane Kickstarter and otherwise available through the publisher, Mythic Games.

The errata pack covers the Core Game and the Right Hand of Doom expansion. It does not cover the additional expansions that were released in Wave 2.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Solomon Kane: The Right Hand of Doom

listing.notes:
Pack that came with the kickstarter pledge much later. Brand new still sealed.
Willing to ship anywhere if you pay for shipping
Brand new with cards in shrink. Will ship immediately. Local pickup available in northern VA (22554) Payment via PayPal please.

boardgame.name: Deck of Rumours - The Big City
boardgame.description:
(Back of Box)

Immerse your players with ease!

Each Deck of Rumours set contains 50 cards themed around a fantasy town noticeboard. Unveil cards at random or use the reference icons on the back of each card to tailor the notices to your world - the choice is up to you!

The Big City

Urban life can be hard, and this deck reflects it! From conspiracies to inner-guild wars, be wary of who you can trust.

boardgame.name: Deck of Rumours - By The Sea
boardgame.description:
(Back of Box)

Immerse your players with ease!

Each Deck of Rumours set contains 50 cards themed around a fantasy town noticeboard. Unveil cards at random or use the reference icons on the back of each card to tailor the notices to your world - the choice is up to you!

By the Sea is the costal themed deck (suitable for all for all climates) with pirates, maps, giant turtles and more!

boardgame.name: Efemerydy Ettrymaga
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Efemerydy Ettrymaga' to dodatek do świata Szlamów&Szkieletów, opisujący przedziwne magiczne przedmioty zwane efemerydami.
Mogą one zapewnić bohaterom niezwykłe możliwości i dosłownie ocalić im skóry w krytycznym momencie, ale jednocześnie ich użycie zawsze niesie nieprzewidywalne konsekwencje, które mogą jeszcze bardziej skomplikować sytuację.

Zaryzykujesz?

boardgame.name: Deck of Rumours - Town Events
boardgame.description:
(Back of Box)

Immerse your players with ease!

Each Deck of Rumours set contains 50 cards themed around a fantasy town noticeboard. Unveil cards at random or use the reference icons on the back of each card to tailor the notices to your world - the choice is up to you!

Town Events covers the big events that would take place in a rural town. Help out with a disastrous wedding, sabotage the ritual sacrifice, defend the villagers from a horde of merciless bandits and many, many, more!

boardgame.name: Ekstaza Błogosławionej Siostry Czupakabry z Laufreich
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zakonnice na prochach, czupakabry, wężoludzie z kosmosu i płonąca stodoła, a to dopiero początek atrakcji.

Ekstaza Błogosławionej Siostry Czupakabry z Laufreich to sandboxowy moduł do gry Szlamy&Szkielety na silniku Freeform Universal. Pozwala on uczestnikom na przemieszczanie się pomiędzy dwiema fantastycznymi krainami pełnych interesujących lokacji, barwnych postaci i tajemnic do odkrycia.

Pierwsza to Laufreich - sielankowa öphagijska wioska pełna prostych ludzi i prostych spraw. Nie ma tu żadnej magii, ale za to pełno cwanych kramarzy, podchmielonych chłopów, psotnych dzieciaków i pobożnych sióstr z pobliskiego klasztoru.

Druga to Velacez - zaginione miasto w głębi tropikalnej dżungli. Wspaniała niegdyś cywilizacja, która, opuszczona przez bogów i prześladowana przez odrażające monstra oraz bezwzględnych kultystów, powoli chyli się ku upadkowi.

Całość została skonstruowana w taki sposób, żeby uczestnicy mogli samodzielnie zdecydować, od czego chcą zacząć eksplorację obu krain i w jaki sposób ma ona przebiegać - bez prowadzenia za rękę od punktu do punktu.

Podręcznik zawiera opisy najważniejszych miejsc i postaci w każdej z krain, mapy obu regionów, całe mnóstwo tabel z zadaniami, znaleziskami i wydarzeniami, wskazówki, jak wykorzystać to wszystko w trakcie gry i ściągawkę kto jest kto.

Przeczytaj, zainspiruj się, poprowadź - przygoda wzywa!

boardgame.name: Deck of Rumours - Village Gossip
boardgame.description:
(Back of Box)

Immerse your players with ease!

Each Deck of Rumours set contains 50 cards themed around a fantasy town noticeboard. Unveil cards at random or use the reference icons on the back of each card to tailor the notices to your world - the choice is up to you!

Village Gossip adds day-to-day themed notices to your village, featuring angry bakers, stolen pigs and dog poo!

boardgame.name: Grobowiec Lim Nu
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Grobowiec Lim Nu to najeżony pułapkami i nieumarłymi potworami orientalny loch do Szlamów&Szkieletów. Śmiałkowie mogą w nim odnaleźć starożytne skarby, zapomniane legendy oraz śmierć w szponach plugawych monstrów.

Przygoda wzywa!

boardgame.name: Niekompletny Atlas Öphagii
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Niekompletny Atlas Öphagii to dodatek do gry Szlamy&Szkielety na silniku Freeform Universal. Wymaga on znajomości podręczników podstawowych do Sz&Sz oraz FU. Składa się on z dwóch części:

Tabele – Zbiór tabel zawierających po dziesięć przykładów popularnych w Öphagii nazw wsi i miast, nazwisk chłopskich i szlacheckich, imion, karczm, świątyń, legalnych oraz nielegalnych organizacji, gór, dolin, lasów, moczarów, jezior i rzek. Do tego tabele z przykładami plotek, możliwych spotkań oraz odkryć w dziczy i na traktach, wraz z ich odpowiednikami po magicznej stronie rzeczywistości.

Mapy – Dwie mapy królestwa Öphagii, na których zaznaczone są tylko najważniejsze szczegóły: granice kraju, położenie stolicy, uniwersytetu oraz skala. Jedna służy do dokumentowania podróży po normalnym świecie, a druga – po zaczarowanej krainie objawiającej się, kiedy magia Öphagii zaczyna działać. Obie mapy pokryte są numerowanymi, sześciokątnymi polami pozwalającymi na wykorzystanie ulubionych zasad eksploracji dziczy (zwanych czasem hexploracją bądź hex crawlem).

boardgame.name: Opowieści z Zamku Öphag
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Opowieści z Zamku Öphag to zbiór opowieści i pomysłów na przygody w fantastycznym świecie Szlamów&Szkieletów. W sam raz na szybką, improwizowaną sesję, albo na nieprzewidziany rozwój wypadków. Zajrzyj, zainspiruj się, zaskocz drużynę!

Przygoda wzywa!

boardgame.name: Deck of Rumours - The Royal Decree
boardgame.description:
(Back of Box)

The Royal Decree summons you and your party to attend the unveiling of a Royal proclamation.

Declarations of war… Birth of a new heir… Royal scandals… This deck will add plenty of empirical flair to your table.

These 40 Royal-Sized cards are suitable for announcements from your leader, whether they’re a czar, empress, monarch, sovereign or usurper!

All Hail Our Majesty!

boardgame.name: Pod Gawronem
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wspólnie z przyjaciółmi odwiedź gospodę Pod Gawronem i odkryj, jaką magię oraz jakie potworności w sobie skrywa. Przygoda wzywa!

Pod Gawronem to krótka przygoda w świecie Szlamów&Szkieletów, świetnie nadająca się na pierwszą sesję oraz jako inspiracja do tworzenia własnych, unikalnych scenariuszy.

Scenariusz zawiera cztery gotowe do gry postacie i wymaga podręcznika podstawowego do Szlamów&Szkieletów oraz do Freeform Universal.

boardgame.name: Deck of Rumours - Maps of Discovery
boardgame.description:
(Back of Box)

Intrigue your players.

This deck of 40 large cards are full of map fragments, directions, dungeon layouts and more!

Every card offers a multitude of plot hooks and curiosities that will engage your group to set forth and venture out into your world!

boardgame.name: Post Mortem
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Narrator: Ok, niech będzie. Wasze postacie nie zginęły, tylko wyjechały na piękną farmę daleko stąd. Są tam bardzo szczęśliwe, więc nie będziemy im przeszkadzać i stworzymy nowe postacie...

Gracze: Organizujemy ucieczkę z farmy!

Post Mortem to krótka przygoda w świecie Szlamów&Szkieletów, świetnie nadająca się do rozegrania, kiedy cała drużyna zginie. Bez przygotowania, bez tworzenia nowych postaci, bez narzekania, że zabawa się skończyła. Uciekasz z nami, czy zostajesz na farmie? Przygoda wzywa!

boardgame.name: Ścieżka na Księżyc
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ścieżka na Księżyc to dodatek do świata Szlamów&Szkieletów poświęcony Księżycowi świecącemu nad Öphagią. Podręcznik zawiera opis magicznej strony Księżyca, czyli Srebrnego Miasta, zamieszkujących je cyber-amazonek, rojących się w podziemiach szlamołazów oraz informacje o lokalnych sekretach i technologiach. Może to być świetna okazja do pomieszania klimatów fantasy i science fiction oraz skonfrontowania bohaterów z zupełnie nową, niezwykłą stroną magicznej rzeczywistości.

boardgame.name: Serce Królowej
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wspólnie z przyjaciółmi poznaj tajemniczą królową wilków i przekonaj się, jak sekret skrywa jej serce! Przygoda wzywa!

Serce Królowej to krótka przygoda w świecie Szlamów&Szkieletów, świetnie nadająca się na krótką sesję oraz jako inspiracja do tworzenia własnych, unikalnych scenariuszy.

Scenariusz zawiera cztery gotowe do gry postacie i wymaga podręcznika podstawowego do Szlamów&Szkieletów oraz do Freeform Universal.

boardgame.name: Szepty wśród Zgliszczy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zbiór materiałów do gry Szlamy&Szkielety na silniku Freeform Universal. Większość zaprezentowanego tutaj materiału to rozmaite artykuły, opowiadania i generatory pochodzące z grupy Gospoda pod Ognistą Kulą, fanpejdża Fajerbol i bloga Kokatryks. Są to materiały powiązane z uniwersum Sz&Sz, ale niepowiązane ze sobą nawzajem, mające stanowić pomoc i inspirację dla uczestników gry, a szczególnie narratorów.

boardgame.name: Tajemnice Zamku Öphag
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wspólnie z przyjaciółmi poznaj Zamek Öphag i jego podziemia, staw czoła jego horrorom, odkryj jego sekrety i sięgnij po jego skarby. Przygoda wzywa!

Tajemnice Zamku Öphag to dodatek do świata Szlamów&Szkieletów, opisujący miejsca, mieszkańców i rekwizyty związane z tytułowym zamkiem. Znajdziesz tu barwny zbiór przyziemnych arystokratów, ich grzeszków, orz nieludzkich monstrów, którymi są po magicznej stronie rzeczywistości.

boardgame.name: Xięga Et
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Przygoda wzywa!

Wspólnie z przyjaciółmi utknij w królestwie Öphagii, spotkaj podobnych sobie rozbitków i odnajdź drogę do domu!

Xięga Et to dodatek do gry Szlamy&Szkielety, opowiadający, w jaki sposób można utknąć po magicznej stronie rzeczywistości, kogo można tam spotkać i jak wrócić do normalnego świata.

boardgame.name: Icon of Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Marshall Vallin bids you take on a dangerous mission, one that entrusts you to deliver a mysterious package. The fate of the Principalities hinges on this mission. Just how much danger you will encounter, well, that remains to be seen.

This solo adventure requires the use of a character of any profession. We advise 3rd or 4th rank.

boardgame.name: Xięga Kociej Łapy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pomiędzy licznymi nićmi tajemnic oplatającymi Öphagię, na miękkich łapach przemykają czujni wysłannicy Hrabiny Katzenkraut, której ciekawości dorównuje jedynie jej porywczość. Nieostrożni wędrowcy powinni uważać na swój każdy krok, aby przypadkiem nie wplątać się w jedną z jej intryg, bowiem z gości prędko mogą przemienić się w zwierzynę.

boardgame.name: Xięga Szkieletów
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wspólnie z przyjaciółmi poznaj królestwo Öphagii, staw czoła zamieszkującym je szkieletom, poznaj ich sekrety i zdobądź ich skarby. Przygoda wzywa!

Xięga Szkieletów to dodatek do gry Szlamy&Szkielety, przybliżający kościanego boga Khemmu i jego nieumarłych wyznawców. Zawiera opisy miejsc, istot, frakcji i przedmiotów, które uczestnicy mogą wedle uznania wykorzystywać w trakcie rozgrywki.

boardgame.name: Xięga Szlamów
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wspólnie z przyjaciółmi poznaj królestwo Öphagii, staw czoła zamieszkującym je szlamom, poznaj ich sekrety i zdobądź ich skarby. Przygoda wzywa!

Xięga Szlamów to dodatek do gry Szlamy&Szkielety, przybliżający galaretowatego boga Gol Golora i jego bezkształtnych wyznawców. Zawiera opisy miejsc, istot, frakcji i przedmiotów, które uczestnicy mogą wedle uznania wykorzystywać w trakcie rozgrywki.

boardgame.name: Zakon Niczego
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zakon Niczego to suplement do gry Szlamy&Szkielety na silniku Freeform Universal, zawierający informacje na temat Zakonu Kawalerów Białego Gryfa pod Wezwaniem Przenajświętszej Myriam Pustułki domu Wvalhskiego w Öphagii (albo krócej – Zakonu Gryfa), związanych z nim miejsc, osób, przedmiotów. Czytelnik znajdzie tutaj również informacje na temat magicznego odbicia gryfitów, czyli sekty czcicieli lotosu.

Krótko mówiąc - więcej miejsc do zwiedzenia, postaci do spotkania,bestii do zgładzenia i tajemnic do odkrycia. Przygoda wzywa!

boardgame.name: Zamek Mrokburg
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zamek Mrokburg to przygoda do gry Szlamy&Szkielety na silniku Freeform Universal. Nie jest to jednak samodzielny scenariusz, a rozbudowany wątek poboczny, stworzony z myślą o wpleceniu go w inną rozgrywaną historię.

Podręcznik pozwala bohaterom graczy objąć w posiadanie zrujnowane zamczysko i w przerwach od innych zadań powoli przywracać mu dawną świetność, przygotowując dla siebie bezpieczne schronienie, w którym można schronić się przed wrogami, lizać rany i szykować się na kolejne wojaże. Będzie to świetne uzupełnienie dłuższej przygody w Sz&Sz, w której postacie zgromadzą wpływy, środki i uznają, że pora znaleźć sobie porządną bazę wypadową.

boardgame.name: Szkoła Wyrwanych Serc
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Szkoła Wyrwanych Serc to dodatek do gry Szlamy&Szkielety na silniku Freeform Universal i do jego efektywnego wykorzystania niezbędna jest znajomość podręczników podstawowych zarówno do Sz&Sz jak i do FU. Jego zadaniem jest ułatwienie uczestnikom gry stworzenia w świecie Sz&Sz uniwersytetu, zaludnienia go studentami, profesorami i rozgrywania na tej kanwie własnych przygód. Zarówno po zwyczajnej, jak i po magicznej stronie Öphagii. Całość składa się z czterech głównych sekcji:

● Narracja – Krótki poradnik, jak tworzyć przygody dla studentów miotających się między magią a rzeczywistością.

● Miejsca – Opisy miasteczka Buchen i uniwersytetu Buchenberg oraz ich magicznych odpowiedników – miasteczka Bluten i uniwersytetu Blutenberg.

● Osoby – Opisy bractwa studenckiego znanego jako Dom Rysia i ważnej persony na uniwersytecie - profesor Luchs oraz ich magicznych odpowiedników – Domu Szpiku i profesora Knochenmarka.

● Bohaterowie – Zbiór deskryptorów i motywów nadających się dla bohaterów uczących się na uniwersytecie Buchenberg.

Sztuczka polega na tym, że opisy zawarte w dwóch pierwszych sekcjach są niekompletne. Zamiast konkretnych informacji zawierają pytania, na które uczestnicy gry muszą sami sobie odpowiedzieć i deskryptory, spośród których muszą wybrać. Wymaga to rzecz jasna poświęcenia większej ilości czasu na przygotowania do sesji (najwygodniej zająć się tym w czasie sesji zero przed tworzeniem postaci), ale w zamian daje uczestnikom gry znacznie większy wpływ na świat gry.

boardgame.name: Casket of Fays (Issue 5 - Nov 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fifth issue of Casket of Fays makes its appearance!
Within its covers can be found an assortment of delights and darksome things to enhance your Dragon Warriors game!

Ranging from the horror that stalks the night, known as 'The Tallow Man', to an encounter with an ensorcelled herd of goats, to a pair of new professions, we bid you welcome to our pages.

More, much more, will be found within the Casket.

boardgame.name: El-Alamein 1942
boardgame.description:
The first battle of El Alamein (1–27 July 1942) was a battle of the Western Desert Campaign of the Second World War, fought in Egypt between Axis forces of the Panzer Army Africa and British Eight Army. Allies managed to stop Rommel's offensive.

In the second battle of El Alamein (23 October – 11 November 1942) Allied forces begun their offensive which turned out to be the beginning of the end of the Axis forces in Africa.

This game covers the entire operation, separated in the short scenarios than can played as stand alone games or together, as longer campaign.

It is third game of the WB-95 system set up in the North Africa (after Desert Rats 1940-42 and Kasserine 1943). El-Alamein 1942 is released with optional, mounted board.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Wielkie Bitwy 1939-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Stategia)
