boardgame.name: Middara: Unintentional Malum – Act 1: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
Official insert compatible with Middara: Unintentional Malum – Act 1 and Middara: Unintentional Malum – Act 1. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. The trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times. The rule books act as a lid on top of the trays.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 51.5 x 34.3 x 12.3 cm.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Flood: Rising Waters
boardgame.description: A 5-6 player expansion with unique Arks and player boards

boardgame.name: Just 1 Minute Tabletop Game
Sixty Seconds Tabletop Game
boardgame.description:
You have just one minute to talk on a given subject - don't let anyone else interrupt. All Wafflers are welcome!

A host is needed as a timekeeper who will also settle disputes.

The host picks a card at random and reads out the topic on the card. The first player has to speak for as long as he can (up to a maximum of one minute) on that subject. Other players listen and can challenge for: Hesitation, Deviation or Repetition.

If a player challenges correctly he can then take over the role of speaker. Whoever is speaking at the end of one minute earns two points. Whoever has most points at the end, when everyone has had an equal number of chances to be first speaker, is the overall winner.

boardgame.name: Monster on Card Game
boardgame.description: The official Monstermon Card Game is finally here! With 50 cards to battle with, you can fight your friends and local dumpster dwellers like you were back in Kindergarten! This player's set includes everything you need to dominate the playground, from the fearsome Ultralodon to the cuddly Marshmallow.

boardgame.name: French Toast: Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
16-card promo pack included for Kickstarter backers (not in the box, shipped separately).

6 "Basic" cards: Beard, Brain, Panda, Shirt, Tiger, Tooth

10 "Advanced" cards: Blood, Coffin, Goblin, Gravestone, Mummy, Museum, Ninja, Surfboard, Triangle, Vampire

boardgame.name: Chimeraland
boardgame.description: An innovative open world game with the imagination of Eastern Mythology. A boundless universe, transform a mystical wilderness, be whatever you want to be

boardgame.name: Mr. Fibonacci and the Great Art Commission of Pisa
boardgame.description:
Pisa 1230. A very demanding client has arrived in the quiet Berlinghiere art workshop: Mr. Fibonacci, the famous mathematician! He wants to make a gift to the Cathedral, a work worthy of being exhibited. An excellent art that is in harmony with the mathematical sciences! Mr. Fibonacci spares no expense and commissions the work to Master Berlingo and Master Bonaventura, but on the condition that the Golden Ratio are sequence of numbers are respected ...

But the two artists fail to be precise and respect the rules that their client imposes. They work day and night on their canvases, in the hope that Mr. Fibonacci will be satisfied. But every time, because of his perfidious nature, the work is discarded because it is not very precise. A really busy challenge; but Mr. Fibonacci is a severe judge! Who will succeed in the enterprise.

Mr. Fibonacci and the Great Art Commission of Pisa is a dice drafting, roll and write game, where two artists (players) are competing to complete artwork for the fastidious client. The one catch? The artwork must be in accordance with the golden ratio. Whichever player completes their three paintings first, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Crypt of the Devil Lich (5E)
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

The heroes are sent into the Devil Lich’s crypt to destroy her before she can return to power, as foreseen in a prophecy. However, the unknowing heroes have actually been tricked into entering her crypt to free her from her prison. If they are truly heroes, they will uncover the deception and defeat the evil Devil Lich before she can unleash her dark designs on the surface world.

Created in homage to Gygax's classic with the goal of providing an even greater challenge, Crypt of the Devil Lich became an instant legend when it was first run as a tournament dungeon crawl. After all, this is the adventure with a mummy dragon, the hall of prophets, and a castle suspended by chains above a lava sea - not to mention a legendary villain! Now, more than 15 years after its original Gen Con debut, we are updating it for the 5th edition and DCC rules sets.

Perhaps the most cherished dungeon crawl ever published by Goodman Games, Crypt of the Devil Lich has been completely updated and converted to new rules sets. It’s ready for your table: are your players ready for the devil lich?

boardgame.name: Kłopoty na Biegunie
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strachy na Skrzaty to przygoda osadzona w uniwersum Jagodowego Lasu.

Jest grudzień. Jagodowy Las przykryła gruba warstwa śniegu. Z drzew opadły liście, ptaki odleciały do ciepłych krajów, sadzawki zamarzły, a większość zwierząt śpi bądź zajmuje się swoimi sprawami. Głównym zadaniem Strażników jest odśnieżanie wioski i zbieranie opału. Dla malutkich krasnali nawet kilka centymetrów śniegu może być poważną przeszkodą, a jeśli spadnie go więcej, to często łatwiej drążyć w nim tunele niż próbować usunąć cały. Zapowiada się kolejna nudna zima wypełniona pracą i oczekiwaniem na wiosnę. Wszystko zmienia się, kiedy do wioski przylatuje nietypowy gość.

boardgame.name: Wesołe Wyprawy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

W tym dodatku znajduje się pięć scenariuszy, których wydarzenia mają miejsce w nowych częściach Jagodowego Lasu oraz poza nim.

boardgame.name: Walentynki krasnodziadków
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Walentynki krasnodziadków to krótka przygoda do Jagodowego Lasu napisana z okazji Święta Zakochanych. Dzieci często reagują zakłopotaniem na wszelkie wątki romantyczne i unikają ich z dużym zaangażowaniem. W przygodzie postawiono więc na motyw miłości dwojga staruszków, którzy są razem od dziesiątek lat, a mimo to nie przestają się kochać. Dziadek Jałowiec zapragnie urządzić dla żony niespodziankę w postaci walentynkowej, uroczystej kolacji i poprosi o wsparcie w przygotowaniu jej. Postacie graczy w czasie pomocy Jałowcowi będą miały okazję wykazać się zmysłem organizacyjnym.

boardgame.name: Strachy na skrzaty
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strachy na Skrzaty to przygoda osadzona w uniwersum Jagodowego Lasu. Opowiada ona o drużynie Strażników, którzy wyruszają na mokradła, żeby sprawdzić pogłoski o grasującym tam rzekomo potworze. Jest to przygoda z dreszczykiem skierowana do dzieci. Nie ma w niej twardej przemocy (nie musi być w niej przemocy w ogóle, każde wyzwanie da się pokonać pokojowymi metodami) i prawdziwych potworów ani niczego tak naprawdę groźnego, ale są w niej miejsca i sytuacje, których dzieci mogą się przestraszyć. Przed rozegraniem przygody narrator powinien więc dokładnie przeczytać całą przygodę i zastanowić się, czy jego pociechy są na takie strachy gotowe, czy może lepiej trochę poczekać albo wprowadzić do przygody jakieś zmiany.

boardgame.name: Sto pomysłów na karczmy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sto pomysłów na karczmy.

boardgame.name: Crypt of the Devil Lich: The Lost Level (5E)
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

A completely new level to the complex, designed in the original tournament style of multiple designers all coordinated by a master dungeon architect.

boardgame.name: Skarbiec zabawek Króla Maciusia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sto lat temu odbyły się 7 urodziny króla Maciusia. Młody monarcha ogłosił na nich, że już nie jest dzieckiem. Trudno jednak pozbyć się ukochanych zabawek i książek, dlatego król samodzielnie zaprojektował swój wymarzony, tajny loch do zabaw.

Dziś zamek jest w ruinie. Nikt nie odnalazł tajnego przejścia do Skarbca. Jednak większość zaklęć i wynalazków dalej działa: mechaniczna obsługa sprząta, a na suficie szklane kule dają jasne światło. To miejsce do szybkiego zwiedzania i skupieniu się na założeniu własnej bazy.

boardgame.name: Grobowiec Gurana
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Usiądź, młody człowieku, i posłuchaj legendy o twierdzy Gurana, która kryje niewyobrażalne skarby i przerażające kreatury wałęsające się po opuszczonych korytarzach potężnego niegdyś fortu krasnoludów. Przygotuj się jednak – to nie bajka dla dzieci!

Grobowiec Gurana to scenariusz do polskiego systemu fantasy Groty i Giganci. Wystarczy na 1-2 sesje skupione na eksplorowaniu legendarnego krasnoludzkiego państwa-miasta. Składa się z trzech poziomów, które razem zawierają kilkadziesiąt pomieszczeń pełnych znalezisk i zagrożeń – to wyzwanie dla prawdziwych śmiałków! Jest tu miejsce zarówno na ekscytujące walki, jak i bardziej pokojowe interakcje ze spotkanymi istotami.

W przygodzie zawarte są mapy podziemi do każdego poziomu lochu oraz rekwizyt dla graczy.

Grobowiec Gurana można łatwo dostosować do innych oldschoolowych systemów w klimatach fantasy.

boardgame.name: Assassin Mammoths
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Assassin Mammoths is a hack of the famous and fabulous Honey Heist. It is a thrilling story about secret society of mammoths, that are planning assassination of the president.

It's quick, it's silly, [and] it's a lot of fun. Simply suspend your disbelieve and may the fun be with you!

boardgame.name: Dziwne Eony
Strange Aeons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dziwne Eony to miniaturowa gra fabularna o kosmicznych rozbitkach, próbujących przetrwać na dziwacznej, prymitywnej planecie rojącej się od bluźnierczych horrorów z pamiętających mroczne początki naszego świata.

Całość mieści się na jednej stronie, ale została przygotowana z myślą o samodzielnym wydrukowaniu i złożeniu w malutką, ośmiostronicową książeczkę (popularnie zwaną pocketmode).

boardgame.name: Excaligator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Excaligator is an outline of an adventure that can be played in most classic fantasy worlds. It will be perfect as a casual one-shot scenario or a starting point for a longer campaign.

This is a classic story about the heroes' struggle with a terrible beast, seasoned with a pinch of power struggle, betrayal and foul magic.

The manual contains all the necessary information about the plot, NPCs and locations.

boardgame.name: Gang Kosmicznych Małp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gang Kosmicznych Małp to prosta i szalona gra fabularna na silniku Honey Heist. Opowiada ona o szajce małp, które chcą się zemścić na Neilu Armstrongu za to, że przywłaszczył sobie chwałę związaną z pierwszym lądowaniem na księżycu, podczas gdy to małpy były pierwsze!

Gra jest szybka, prosta, nie wymaga specjalnego przygotowania i doskonale sprawdzi się na wszelkiej maści imprezach, konwentach i spotkaniach towarzyskich (no, może poza pogrzebami).

boardgame.name: The 52nd State
boardgame.description:
The game is simple; it's politics. You are a lawmaker in this brand new state. Make laws and convince the other players to pass your laws. It doesn't matter how you feel about the law, just make sure it passes.

On each player’s turn, they’ll propose a law by combining an “Issue” card and a “Law” card. The group can vote on this combination as-is, or another player (or several players) can propose an “Exception” card to be combined with these two cards.

As a group you all vote for the best combination and whether it includes an Exception, or if it’s the original two card combination on its own. When a new law is passed, the proposing player keeps their “Issue” card as a win token, and if an Exception was passed with the law, the player that played the Exception card keeps their “Exception” card as a win token as well. The “Law” card is put back to the bottom of the deck to be reused if needed.

The “Law” and “Exception” cards each count as a single point. At the end of the game, whoever has the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Promos Box
boardgame.description: This set contains all exclusive stretch goals and daily reveals unlocked during the Marvel Zombies Kickstarter, along with a box to store everything.

boardgame.name: Jesienna Wędrówka
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jesienna Wędrówka to gra fabularna fantasy dla 2 osób. Jeden z graczy wciela się w postać Śmiałka, który wyrusza w drogę przez pełne niebezpieczeństw ziemie królestwa do jego stolicy. Drugi gracz wciela się w rolę Gawędziarza, który opisuje napotkane przez Śmiałka zagrożenia.

boardgame.name: Vengeful Wight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You died a tragic and unjust death, caused by the machinations of your worst enemy. The ending of your story was too abrupt and too unsatisfying for the mysterious forces controlling the fate of the world. They have decided to grant you a second chance. You woke up, feeling the bitter taste of death in your mouth and a burning anger in your heart. You will not rest until you get your revenge.

boardgame.name: Głos Piwnicy (No. 1 - Jun 2020)
boardgame.description:
Głos Piwnicy
No. 1
June 2020
boardgame.rpg: They Came From Beneath the Sea!

boardgame.description:
Głos Piwnicy
No. 3
Oct 2020

boardgame.description:
Głos Piwnicy
No. 2

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Zombie Miniatures
boardgame.description: Zombie miniatures for the Terror from the Grave vignette.

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Bird Miniatures
boardgame.description: Bird miniatures for the Terror from Above vignette.

boardgame.name: Cartoon Kingdom
boardgame.description:
(from the back cover of the game)

An incredible collection of activities that will give your kids hours & hours of fun.

5 different cartoon characters:
- Atlantis
- Crazy bears
- Dalmatians
- Mouse patrol
- Toy world

Each cartoon character has 5 different activities
- Character dresser
- Dot to dot activity
- Simon activity
- Pairs activity with 16, 24 and 32 cards
- Block swap activity with 3x3, 4x4, 5x5 and 6x6 icons

boardgame.name: Ultra Werewolf 2.0 Playing Cards
boardgame.description:
A combination of a upgraded Werewolf game and Waterproof and Anti-folding Playing cards.

It's a Werewolf game with more characters in different situations and more varieties and conditions to win.

boardgame.name: KuZOOkA
boardgame.description:
It isn't easy being a zoo animal. The enclosures are far too small for your needs, the daily routine is boring, and the visitors to the zoo are too obnoxious. You have decided: You need to break out of the zoo, ideally within the next seven days.

There are multiple ways to escape in KuZOOkA, but you need to work together with the other animals — in secret — to pool the trash left behind by zoo visitors and develop an escape plan that makes use of these items. Each player has one of the ten animal cards with a unique power, and you play on a game board that features a path comprised of spaces in six colors, with each space having a number in it.

In each round, a number of item cards is dealt out to players, with 20-22 cards being dealt in the first round. Cards show a colored item, e.g., a red ice cream spoon or a purple scarf. On a turn, you place one of your animal tokens on the path farther than any other animal token, say, in the 1 red space or the 2 purple space, to give some indication of what you have in hand. (The first player is limited to one of the first five spaces.) The next player places one of their tokens farther down the path, and so on, with each placement giving players a chance to suggest what cards they hold in hand. A player can use their animal power once during a round.

At some point a player will decide that instead of placing an animal token, it's time to attempt an escape. At that point, all players reveal all cards of the color matching the location of the animal token furthest down the path. If you have more cards, you gain experience stars equal to the number depicted on that space — and with experience stars, you can purchase a higher starting experience level, which means you'll have more cards in play, including face-up cards visible to all. If you have exactly as many cards as the number depicted, you gain experience stars as well as a universal tool card that counts as a joker. If you have fewer cards, you fail.

Shuffle all cards, then deal out the current number of cards and start a new round. If during a round you manage to reach one of the six final spaces on the track and you have at least that many cards of the designated color, you escape and win the game. If you fail to do this by the end of the seventh round, you lose.

You can increase the difficulty of KuZOOkA by requiring more stars to advance in experience level or by playing on the opposite side of the game board, which requires you to win universal tools in order to succeed in the final six spaces.

boardgame.name: Eclipse: Neue Gefahren
boardgame.description:
This mini-expansion contains several small modules that can be added to the base game individually or in combination, adding even more variety to the conquest of space.

4 new modules for Eclipse - Second Dawn for the Galaxy

Galaktische Ereignisse ( Galactic Events )
Aufstrebende Spezies ( Minor Species )
Neue Ordnung ( Turn Order Variant )
Risskanone ( Rift Cannon )


Explore black holes and galactic nebulae, negotiate with emerging species, compete in the galactic council, or experiment with reality warping weapons technology.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy – Galactic Events
Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy – Minor Species
Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy – Rift Cannon
Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy – Turn Order Variant

boardgame.name: Von Falkenstein
boardgame.description:
A dreadful knight is pursuing innocent people! They must remember the best route to safety in order to escape the knight and defend the castle. To begin, the players decide which story they would like to play: "Ambush at Münzenberg Castle" or "Revenge of the Rockenberger Robber Barons". The rules of the game remain the same. However, there is a special rule that makes the game a little more difficult for the Rockenberg story.

Like Celtic, Von Falkenstein is a game set in the German region Wetterau, where Pegasus Spiele is located. It tells stories from two nearby cities, Münzenberg and Rockenberg.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Captain Sonar: Mission Vectrum
boardgame.description:
Mission Vectrum is a mini-expansion for Captain Sonar and contains three different sea cards that can be played individually or as a coherent campaign. Each sea card is included four times: two times for the radio operators and two times for the captains.

With its 3 missions, the Vectrum campaign make you dive you into a thrilling adventure. A cutting-edge military-scientific conglomerate has recruited experienced crews to test their new equipment in real conditions. Welcome to the Vectrum Campaign, which will take you from Chicago to New York to end with a climax on a secret mission! The Vectrum campaign includes 3 missions, which can be played consecutively in a “campaign” mode, or individually, with their specific rules and constraints.

boardgame.name: Wyścigi
boardgame.description: Polish game released in the mid 80's. The goal of the game is to lead a team of 4 horses through an obstacle race. Horses for successive places receive points. The player with the most points wins. The game board is built of movable elements according to the plan included in the manual. You can also create your own race tracks.

boardgame.name: Unsighted
boardgame.description:
User Summary

You are Alma, an automaton who wakes up with little memory of what happened. The humans have destroyed the world and you must restore some semblance of order. Unfortunately, the life essence of all automatons is being depleted. As time marches on, NPCs will loose their essence. When gone, they will be transformed into the Unsighted and you will need to destroy them. Time truly is not on your side.

boardgame.name: Bangkok
boardgame.description:
In Bangkok, players take the role of dealers building their floating market.
It's up to you to negociate in the port to choose the most advantageous barges and goods and place them thoughtfully in your market. The player with the most profitable business wins!

How to play:

Deal 3 "barge" cards to each player
Place 3 rows of 3 "barge" cards in the center, called Central Market.
Deal a secret objective to each player.


During their turn must:


Switch cards from your hand with some from the Central Market
Add cards to their own Floating Market


Spice cards add value to you Market. There are four ways you can add value to your Market.
The round ends when a player has completed their Market with nine cards in total.
The player with the most points wins the round.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Conseil de Guerre Chapitre 1: Tragédie du Choix
boardgame.description:
Make card combos to win the most Tapans at the end of the game. Make your combos thanks to your cards and the cards played by the other players. Play the right card in the right place at the right time!

Each player in turn places a card on the game board and performs its effect, he then wins Tapans and/or draws cards. The objective is to have the most Tapans at the end of the game. On the cards, special effects called Reactivation Effects allow you to make combos based on adjacent cards and can earn a large number of Tapans to whoever activates them. Thus, you have to build your strategy by bouncing on the cards of others while preventing them from bouncing on yours in order to win the maximum number of coins!

-- description from publisher

boardgame.name: Chaos at Crossriver Span
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Crossriver Span has been seized by the Iron Tusk Orcs! A desperate Baron hopes to save his town from imminent attack and sends the Player Characters to repel the Orcs or dislodge the bridge. But this is no easy quest--the Orcs are tough, smart, and have a new Chieftain with a few surprises of his own!

boardgame.name: Blockbuster and Chill
boardgame.description:
Now showing at a couch near you! Get ready for a Blockbuster movie game for two.

In the newest installment of the Blockbuster game series, get ready for some serious teamwork and laughter with Blockbuster and Chill. Beat the game with your partner to become victorious. Be prepared to feel the 90’s nostalgia, as this game comes with old school Blockbuster VHS sleeves, just like how you remember them. Whether you’re with a special someone or hanging out with your buddy, this one’s all about working together.

To beat the game, you’ll need to team up and figure out the mystery movies in front of you before the time runs out… and the dreaded ‘Late Fees’ come-a-knocking. Pick up too many Late Fees and it’s game over! Blockbuster and Chill has categories like “Movies with Sharks” and “Movies by Steven Spielberg” that will having you coming up with creative answers and laughing out loud. This simple game is perfect for date nights, hanging out with a friend, or having a laugh with your parents.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Astroforce: Away Team
boardgame.description:
In Astroforce: The Away Team expansion you have so much more to deal with, not just the mission in hand, but also organising and surviving an Away Team mission too.

This expansion adds a whole new dimension to Astroforce: The Dice Game

NOTE: You need a copy of Astroforce the Dice Game to use this product

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Tamashii: Chronicle of Ascend
boardgame.description:
Tamashii is a cyberpunk adventure board game with a post-apocalyptic vibe. Players will struggle to survive and pursue their agendas in two worlds at the same time - the physical one, filled with deadly machines and merciless human survivors, and the virtual one, prowled by tracking software and vicious viruses.

Players will try to achieve their goals on a modular city map. They will find new locations, fight against strong enemies and search for important information and files needed to win the game.

The second part of the game takes action on a virtual map. Here you will try to hack your opponents, unlock special bonuses or get one-time bonuses for completing the sequences.

The game may be played in different scenarios. You might have to cooperate with other players, play against them or even make an alliances with your enemies. But watch every step you take; every conflict, cooperation or alliance might be a double-edged sword.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Netflix: Trending Now
boardgame.description:
The Judge flips over a Situation, unleasing a flurry of Netflix recommendations from the peanut gallery.

The peanut gallery chooses content and a plot twist from their hand. Which content and plot twist combo will win the Judge's heart? The player on the Judge's left is the Drama Llama, who has the ability to add additional drama to the choices. Whose plans will get disrupted by the Drama Llama at the worst possible time?

Players continue to rotate between the Judge, the Drama Llama, and the Peanut Gallery. If the Judge picks your show, you earn the Situation Card; earn five cards to be crowned Champion of the Remote and take charge of what you watch next on Netflix.

boardgame.name: All Hallows' Eve
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the world of All Hallows' Eve, a never ending rush to grab the candy before the Monsters grab you! In this game, you can take either the role of the Chaperone in charge of keeping all the Trick or Treaters safe or as one of the many Monsters inhabiting this world. Who will win? Will the Trick or Treaters gather the candy before the Monsters get them all? Grab your candy bag and head out onto the leaf-strewn streets to find out!

The Chaperone bookends rounds by moving teams of Trick or Treaters towards houses with the goal of keeping them alive and collecting all the Candy with at least one Trick or Treater staying alive by the end of the game. Everyone else plays as one of the Montsers, each with an personalized deck of attacks and abilities with the goal of gobbling up as many Trick or Treaters as possible before they collect the last piece of Candy. If the Chaperone collects all the candy they win. If the Monsters gobble up all the Trick or Treaters, the Monster with the most Trick or Treaters collected wins.

boardgame.name: The Royal Nuptials of Prince Merrick and Princess Grugunloch d'Orc
boardgame.description:
Peace! It has finally happened! House Lindsor of the human High Kingdom of Tormond and High Clan Brawndor of the orc Territory of Shonjer have decided to become allies at long last, and it just took their heir apparents falling in love to make it so. As a sign of their unbreakable love and of the unflappable bond between the two domains, Tormond’s prince and Shonjer’s princess are wedding – and you have been invited! Well… as security… Funny enough, not everyone is thrilled about the match, and the high chieftain and high king both suspect trouble the day of the ceremony. But the happy couple need not worry about their day of bliss being ruined while you’re watching things! Right? ...right?

Royal Nuptials is a dungeon crawl presented in the form of a wedding. It is intended to have a bit of whimsy to it, and it fits in well as a comical one-shot to breakup more serious gameplay. Using the Wedding Program, your players will navigate to different points around the estate where the ceremony is taking place. You’ll be able to refer to the Challenge Program to see what they encounter as they patrol and, hopefully, make it to the end of the wedding with a happy bride and groom, and a hefty payday!

boardgame.name: Coloring In The Stained Glass
boardgame.description:
In this competitive coloring game, players are tasked with planning the color scheme for the last window in the town cathedral, and will be evaluated by the king based on set criteria. Through drafting pencils from the center of the table, players will color in their window, hoping that they will be the first to finish certain areas.

Grab some colored pencils from your drawer as well as some friends (or play by yourself), and see how well you can do in this unique take on a Roll and Write game.

On a turn player(s) will count the remaining colored pencils in the middle of the table, this is the number of adjacent spaces the player will be allowed to color in. The color they draft is the color they can use with one exception, they can't add to a color already on the window. When the last pencil is drafted place all pencils back in the center and start again.

Players get certain amounts of points for completing certain areas first and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

boardgame.name: Wine Management
boardgame.description:
Wine Management is a print-and-play, roll-and-write game in which players run competing vineyards. Using the values of two out of three rolled dice, players select an action, and a multiplier each round. The actions are:


Plant vines
Harvest vines to produce grapes
Process grapes to make wines
Complete wine orders
Hire workers to unlock one-time bonuses
Deliver tours of your vineyard to gain popularity



Players must balance all the possible actions to maximize their points.

boardgame.name: Builders of Blankenburg: Foundations Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
Description: Add another twist to your adventures in Blankenburg. Foundations includes new foundation cards that allow you to reserve space in the town, along with some special structures and a new character.

Note: Cards are printed on same stock as Fields & Flocks.

Includes:
- 6 Foundation cards

- 3 Structure cards
-- Manor
-- Guild Hall
-- Shrine

- 1 Character card
-- Reeve

- 1 Rules aid card

At this time, this exclusive mini-expansion is only available through the publisher at the Cobblestone website.

boardgame.name: Sunny Day Sardines: Wild Fish
boardgame.description: Two wild cards that can be added to your sardines deck. These two cards contain a portion of each of the four fish colors in the game. It represents a single fish of your choice when you redeem your set. The pack contains two cards that are not included in the base game.

boardgame.name: Pacific 1941-45
boardgame.description:
Pacific 1941-45 covers several land battles fought at the islands of Pacific Ocean during the World War 2. There is big variety of battles, from very small ones, through medium, to the biggest clashes.

Navy and air force are present as well, but mostly as a support forces of both sides. Games are focused on the land units. Most of the battles are fought between US and Japanese forces, but there is a battle of Shumshu, were Soviet units landed in the middle of 1945.

Game was released in B-35 system, which is company/battalon scale, but smaller units are sometimes present as well. Each day has two turns, day and night. There are special units, like snipers, combat engineers, anti tank units, mortars, anti air and so.

Some more battles were released as expansions in the publsher's magazine.

Battles in the box:
- Betio
- Green Island
- Roi Namur
- Kwajalein
- Angaur
- Peleliu
- Saipan
- Shumshu

Battles released in the magazine:
- Wakde (44 issue)
- Wake (45 issue)

boardgame.name: Attack The Dungeon!
boardgame.description:
Attack The Dungeon! is a Playing Card based RPG. To get started you need 1 Deck Of Cards and a Pair Of Dice. Next separate the Aces from the Deck And the face cards also split the dick into 2 halves 1 going upto 6 from 2 and the other from 7 to 10 then Here's Where You get to Choose your Class From the 4 Aces:
Spades = Thief
Diamonds = Mage
Hearts = Warrier
Clubs = Horder

The Dungeon is split into 3 Sections : Cards going up to 6 are beginner & mid level dungeons. Cards 7 - 10 are the higher level dungeons. Place a Jack and your hero on the table and roll for damage. The winner is the player who is alive at the end.

boardgame.name: Bloc by Bloc: Uprising
boardgame.description:
In Bloc by Bloc: Uprising, each player controls a faction of revolutionaries—Workers, Students, Neighbors, or Prisoners—fighting against the police in the streets of a city that changes with each game. Build barricades, clash with police, occupy districts, loot shopping centers, build mutual aid networks, and liberate the city before time runs out and the military arrives!

Object of the Game: When playing fully cooperatively, all factions win or lose together and must cooperate to defeat the police and liberate the city. To liberate the city, each faction must complete the objectives on 1 Conditions card. Each Conditions card specifies certain districts of the city that must be liberated and where occupations must be built. When playing semi-cooperatively, each faction has a secret Agenda card that determines how it wins the game. Factions with Social Agendas can still win together cooperatively. But a faction with a Vanguardist or Sectarian Agenda can only win alone and must work covertly to undermine the other factions.

Bloc by Bloc is played in rounds and each round is 1 night. The countdown marker starts with 10 nights remaining. Each night has 2 phases, Nighttime and Sunrise.

Nighttime: The Nighttime phase is when each faction takes its turn. At the start of a turn, cards are drawn from the Police Ops deck that move and deploy police squads across the city. Higher Police Morale means more cards. Next, the faction rolls action dice and spends those dice to take various actions around the city using their blocs. Each bloc represents an organized group of 5-15 people.

Sunrise: After each faction has taken its turn, the Reaction card orders police to attack and police vans to move around the city. Next, factions may liberate districts and draw Liberation cards if enough blocs are gathered in those districts. There might also be a meeting to draw more Conditions cards. And don’t forget to check if the game has been won! If not, move the countdown forward at the speed of Police Morale, start the next night, and continue playing. If time runs out or any 1 faction has no blocs in the city, all factions lose.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Bloc by Bloc: The Insurrection Game

boardgame.name: Lone Wolf: Flight From the Dark - Soundtrack
boardgame.description:
User summary:
Cassette soundtrack to accompany the classic Lone Wolf adventure book, Flight from the Dark. Art and text from the book is reproduced on the J-card of this soundtrack by Gnoll.

boardgame.name: Globe Runner
boardgame.description:
Globe Runner is a classic race around the world board game for all the family that uniquely contains questions on every country in the world.

Learn as you play by answering multiple choice questions on countries, capitals, flags, etc. to get a bonus go and encounter the hazards of crossing Antarctica, rounding the treacherous Cape Horn or getting lost in the Sahara, Amazon or Bermuda triangle!

Adjustable to the age & abilities of the players allowing people with different levels of knowledge to play together.

Quick, simple, fun and a great way to learn all about the world. First around the world wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Save Your Bacon!
boardgame.description:
Save your bacon in this cute but brutal breakfast game! Buy characters and action cards from a limited shared shop. Fight and steal from other players to get the characters you want. This fast paced game continues until a player assembles the ultimate breakfast or only one player still has the greatest breakfast food of all: bacon!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tricky!: Fantasy Feud
boardgame.description:
Tricky! is a chaotic, unpredictable trick-taking game that asks you to predict it anyway. The game is compatible for 2 to 5 players. Each player plays cards to win tricks against the others over multiple rounds.

Players score points by winning tricks (or turns), correctly betting how many tricks they will win per round, and successfully executing certain abilities. The game lasts, at a minimum, long enough for each player to be dealer. For longer games, each player may be dealer multiple times. After the final round, the player with the most accumulated points is the winner.

The game is composed of 46 game cards. These cards are divided into three suits: HUMAN, DWARF, and DARK ELF, and one wildcard. Each suit is made up of fifteen different cards, each card having a distinct value, indicated by both the number in the top left and bottom right corners of the card. A card’s value is akin to its strength or power. If two cards share the same suit, the card with a higher value will beat the card with a lower value, thus winning the trick (or turn).

Each round consists of a series of 7 turns for each player, called tricks. Every trick, each player will play one card from their hand face up into the middle. One player will lead (that is, play the first card of the trick), and the others will follow in clockwise order. Based on the cards played, one player will be said to win the trick.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jetlag
boardgame.description: Jetlag is a trivia / ambiance game in which players have to answer simple questions but always giving the answer to the previous question all this as fast as possible.

boardgame.name: Mars Rover Rescue
boardgame.description:
In the Mars Rover Rescue Memory Card Game, players assemble a combination of cards including a ship, base, truck, and explorer crew to be the first to find the lost rover.

It's quick and easy to play even for young children, taking around 15 minutes. It’s a stand-alone companion to the Mars Rover Rescue book.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lothar and the Djinn
boardgame.description:
In-Game Introduction

You are Lothar, an Arabian warrior. You are a mighty but mundane man. Recently in ancient Baghdad you were approached by a djinn (a male genie) and offered a very strange proposition:

'Rescue my genie from the caliph and I grant three wishes.'

User Summary

A short and somewhat tongue-in-cheek Arabian Nights themed adventure in the style of a Choose Your Own Adventure book. Will Lothar rescue the genie and get his three wishes, or end up as yet another victim of the evil caliph? It's all up to you and the decisions you make!

boardgame.name: Spacematch
boardgame.description:
SpaceMatch is a fun, quick, and easy to learn solar system card game. You explore, trade, and steal cards from other players to assemble as many planet-moon sets as possible (e.g., Jupiter-Io-Europa-Ganymede-Callisto).

SpaceMatch is full of educational facts, but it's easy for kids (around 6+) to play while learning about the planets, moons, and asteroids of our solar system. Though designed with kids in mind, the game includes enough strategy to be fun for adults - making it perfect for classrooms and family game nights.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: eMEMO America
boardgame.description:
EMemo is a tile matching game for 1-2 players. Match the photos from locations around the US and learn fascinating facts at the same time. Plus Bonus CD-ROM with extra content.

In the two player versions, players compete to be the first to match a set of tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game, wins.

boardgame.name: eMEMO München
boardgame.description:
EMemo is a tile matching game for 1-2 players. Match the photos from locations around Munich and learn fascinating facts at the same time. Plus Bonus CD-ROM with extra content.

In the two player versions, players compete to be the first to match a set of tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game, wins.

boardgame.name: Tomorrow
boardgame.description:
Minimalist asymmetric game for 2 players

The authoritarian and liberticide government increases its hold on the people. Faced with it, a group of pacifist and idealistic rebels, the Dragonflies, fight for a better tomorrow...

The government will do everything in its power to prevent the Dragonflies from exposing their actions. Who will win?

On his turn, a player performs 2 actions, among:
- Draw a card
- Play a card
- Discard a card
- Use a Leader action

The game ends if the rebel player has reached 15 influence points, or if the government player has arrested all 3 leaders.

boardgame.name: Infiltrés
boardgame.description:
Infiltrés is a party game that plays on memory and bluff. With 110 cards, 5 games are available for 1 to 12 players in 5 minute rounds.

The cards are divided into Role cards and Cargo cards. Role cards give a hidden identity that defines the player's goals according to his team. Cargo cards are the game cards that will allow him to achieve this goal.

The 5 games represent the steps of the journey of the Coal Conveyors:

Loading: 2 to 5 players
Each player place a Cargo card in one of the 9 wagons, then the players cover them until they no longer have cards in hand. The team that has the majority on top of the wagon wins.

Travel: 1 to 2 players
The convoy must pass through the 3 steps Mine, Wagon and Customs before arriving. Along the way, the Conveyor tries to fill up with a maximum of Coal, while the Traitor tries to get Werewolves into the Coal. The points are counted individually at the arrival of the convoy.

Halt: 3 to 6 players
Players exchange cards with the convoy stopped in the center. Each one tries to fill his hand or the convoy with his favorite Cargo cards, unless the Striders come to modify the balance.

Customs: 3 to 12 joueurs
Each player is responsible for a load (4 or 5 Cargo cards), each in turn takes the role of the customs officer. The customs officer must allow in a load proposed by another player. The Conveyors are trying to take 5 Coals in a row, while the Traitors win if 2 Werewolves go through customs.

Raid: 2 to 4 players
Traitors seek Striders, while Striders search for Werewolves. All cards are present in the center, face down, the first team that indicates the position of the 3 opponents wins.

description from publisher.

boardgame.name: 1942: Carrier Duel in the Pacific
boardgame.description:
A pacific war campaign game from spring 1942 after the success of the first stage. Players are divided into Japanese (6 CV) and U.S. (5 CV) forces, commanding aircraft carriers and fighting each other to reach the control of 5 keys airfields.

boardgame.name: Traders & Raiders
boardgame.description:
Traders & Raiders is a medieval fantasy strategy game.

On a player's turn they place a player token on an action space. Players choose a group action, meaning all players take that action, or choose a solo action, pay a resource, and act alone.

Actions include moving their character standee from one town on the map board to another, trading goods in the town where they are located, recruiting follower cards that give new abilities to the player, buy special weapon tiles that help in defeating monsters, build market tents (wooden tokens) that give more options when trading, build building cards for points and to produce additional goods, fight monsters (tokens of unknown power) and retrieve their plundered goods, and collect goods found in their current location. Strategies to win include managing resources, maximizing trades, building cards before other players, gaining the right combination of followers so each turn can produce the most resources, gold, and points.

The game ends after 8 rounds when the eighth fortnight tile (or round tile) is placed on a special fortnight board. The player with the most points wins. Points are totaled up from building cards, follower cards, gold, monsters defeated, and certain followers' special abilities.

boardgame.name: Wunder
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Created as an edu-tainment activity, Wunder at its core is a practice drill for translating 78 weak German verbs to and from English. Rather than simply presenting these as a boring Q&A, Wunder places this linguistic quiz into an action-arcade game.

After selecting the starting level, you are wunderwarped to a field filled with electrified posts and surrounded by an electric fence. The player must avoid these deadly obstacles while trying to catch the four guards moving around the area. Your goal is to catch each guard and correctly translate the word printed on the guard's shirt. This sends the guard into a frenzied panic, causing him to run rapidly around the field before eventually frying himself on one of the obstacles. As the game progresses, the field not only becomes more crowded with the electric posts, but relentless and indestructible electrified robots are added to the mix - avoid them or die!

After you successfully complete the fourth level (or get fried by a fence or robot), a scoring screen displays the number of guards caught, the number of successful translations, and the number of hints you used to complete the game.

As a BASIC game, the new downloadable content edition of Wunder can be typed into a physical TRS-80, or the program file (WUNDER2/BAS) can be directly loaded into a TRS-80 emulator.

boardgame.name: What The Dub?!
boardgame.description:
What The Dub?! is a party game for 3 to 6 players, each entering their own dialogue and/or sound effects to fill a gap in a short clip from a B movie or PSA. The players (along with up to 12 additional players, "audience members") vote on their favorites each round, and the player with the most points at the end wins.

User Summary

boardgame.name: Leo Lausemaus Klatsch-Memo
boardgame.description:
A memory variant. 54 cards (27 pairs) are placed randomly on the table, face-down. Players take turns flipping over one tile and leaving it open. When a pair shows, all players try to put their hands on the two tiles. Whoever is first on any of the tiles gets it. The player with most tiles at the end of the game is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fallschirm
boardgame.description:
Game covers several air landing operations performed during World War II by the German airborne units (Fallschirmjager). Scale of the operations varies, from small actions (like attack on Corinth channel) to the major battles, like attack on Crete.

Among these battles are two hypothetical ones - German attack on Malta (operation Hercule) and Italian attack on Maltha (Folgore). All the rest are historical battles, along with such less known battles like landings on Kos and Leros islands.

Game uses B-35 system, which is company/battalion scale system of the high complexity. It is the oldest Polish wargames system, developed since early 90's and still getting new games. Current edition of the B-35 is 4th.

boardgame.name: D-Day to the Rhine, 1944
boardgame.description:
D-Day to the Rhine, 1944 is the follow up to, Battle of the Bulge 1944. D-Day to the Rhine, 1944 follows WWII on the Western Front from June of 1944 until March of 1945.

As the German player, you will set your defenses to meet the Allied landings. As the Allied player you will land and try to break out and drive across France as quickly as possible. Can you cross the Rhine and break through the West Wall before Christmas?

The game includes variable objectives that are picked before the game begins creating a great sense of tension as neither player truly knows his opponents objectives before the game begins.

Optional rules are included for landings other than in Normandy, and hidden German units.

Most of the objectives for victory are the elimination of enemy units and for the Allies getting into Germany before 1945.

boardgame.name: The Kourt of Exile
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Banished from the Kingdom? Run out of town? Tossed out of the pub? Welcome to Exile!

The Kourt of Exile is just over that bridge, and past the guards. Mind yourself as the toll will come due before you can exit. Can't afford the toll? Well I hear there will be a tournament held soon, maybe you can win it.

Haunted by an eldritch god, and a slew of unusual figures, the Kourt of Exile is a pit stop for all who are in a need for a change of scenery. Inspired by the game show Taskmaster, it asks of players to come up with solutions to benign tasks. The points awarded are not always fair, but hopefully still fun.

---

What is inside?

30~ pages of system neutral TTRPG content.
Black and white illustrations.
Tournament style game play, that is easy to randomize.
6 hosts each with their own tables of prizes, trials, and arena maps.
Playable class/union of Bridge Guardians.
And a bridge to anywhere else...

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl: Spike! 2021 Blood Bowl Almanac
boardgame.description:
The 2021 Almanac contains:


Spike! Journal issues 11 through 13, containing all the team rosters, Star Player rules, and assorted rules for leagues, inducements, and more!



Star Player retrospectives on a number of famous Blood Bowl players: Barik Farblast, Fungus the Loon, Bomber Dribblesnot, and Kreek "the Verminator" Rustgouger!



Introducing the new All-Star Spectacular, where legends of the game come together to play the most exciting and star-studded exhibition game in Blood Bowl history!



Alternative Star Player rules - allowing your team to hire your favourites for an entire season!



A suite of new rules for letting multiple college teams loose in the dungeons of the Old World, providing the scintillating spectacle that is multiplayer Dungeon Bowl!



The full history of the prestigious Blood Bowl, complete with all the stats from everyone's favourite Vampire: Jim Johnson!



Plus all the regular Spike! Journal features such as Chat with the Rat, Dirt from the Dugout, Coffin Corner, and an extended kit review with Tatzina Barbarini!


—description from the publisher
